project.title: DeSpace QF: Public Goods Funding in Space
project.description:
# Project Title: DeSpace Quadratic Fund

## Abstract 

To align the Decentralized Space Exploration Ecosystem for public goods funding, we propose the DeSpace Quadratic Funding Grants Round. This initiative aims to raise and distribute funds to support the DeSpace ecosystem.

## DeSpace Examples: 
- DAOs
- NFT collections
- Metaverses
- Blockchain Nodes

## Background: 
In the previous community-driven [Decentralized Science Round on Gitcoin](https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/1/0x6e8dc2e623204d61b0e59e668702654ae336c9f7), there was significant demand for Hardware & Decentralized Space Exploration projects. This round also laid the groundwork for the DeSpace QF because of intense preparations that built on top of the success of [DeSpace: Space Founder Circles](https://www.spacefoundercircles.com/) in collaboration with ReFiDAO. With the current momentum in the Web3 market, the project aims to fund public goods related to Outer Space using Quadratic Funding.

## Problem Statement: 
Startups and research projects often face challenges in securing initial funding and public awareness. For Public Goods projects, such as Open Space/Lunar, funding challenges can hinder long-term independence and the acceleration of innovative space technologies.

## Solution: 
The rising popularity of DeSpace presents an opportunity to establish a platform that unifies the broader DeSpace ecosystem with aligned values as outlined in the [DeSpace Manifesto](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YWnfN8l2VlQA-n5QxNH9oDdJ1soqe-_EaQmVfi_G_9g/). The DeSpace Quadratic Fund aims to achieve this.

## What is Decentralized Space Exploration: 
Decentralized Space Exploration is a sub-niche within web3 merging space exploration with decentralized systems. Instead of being dominated by major national space agencies or billionaires, this approach allows multiple entities or individuals to participate in space missions. Leveraging blockchain and community-driven initiatives, it promotes open-source technology, collective decision-making, and crowdfunding. This democratizes space activities, fostering inclusivity, sustainability, and innovation in Space by distributing control and participation across a broader community.

## Public Good Definition: 
A Public Good is non-excludable and non-rivalrous. In the context of the "DeSpace Quadratic Fund", it refers to projects that benefit the broader decentralized space exploration community.

## Quadratic Funding Explanation: 
Quadratic Funding (QF) is a democratic funding method for public goods. It prioritizes the number of contributors over the amount contributed, ensuring projects with broad community support receive appropriate funding.

## Benefits of Quadratic Funding for Space Public Goods: 
The first framework is proposed in the [DeSpace QF Lightpaper](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ygLWjt32Na3fCXvuruUyoNKaXqS3urfkr63FjnTPMo0/). Using QF for space-related public goods ensures projects with wide community backing receive amplified funding. This approach captures the public's desires and needs, making it ideal for supporting space-related public goods projects.

## Benefits: 
- Attract relevant DeSpace project audiences.
- Raise awareness across the DeSpace ecosystem.
- Position as a hub for the DeSpace ecosystem.
- Provide initial funding and promotion for researchers and projects.
- Create a Proof of Concept for Public Goods funding in Space Science.

## Risks: 
- Insufficient initial funding.
- Funding the wrong projects.
- Potential for fraud and Sybil attacks.
- High Gas Fees.
- Challenges in KPI measurements & user onboarding.

## Learnings from the Last Decentralized Science Round: 
The team will leverage tools like Gitcoin’s Passport and Sybill Analysis Toolkit, switch to Optimism for low Gas Fees, and involve the B2B team for engagement.

## Why this team? 
We aligned leading DeSpace innovators, scientists and entrepreneurs from Space DAOs like [MoonDAO](https://moondao.com/), [SpaceRoxDAO](https://spacerox.org/), [Alpha Persei](https://alphapersei.com/) and [SpaceDAO.AI](https://spacedao.ai/) to sit on one table, start this initiative and grow our ecosystem for the benefit of all!

We already committed advisors and supporters from [Copernic Space](https://copernicspace.com/), [Lunargistics](https://lunargistics.com/), [Axiom Space](https://www.axiomspace.com/) and [Astrocool](https://astrocool.com/) offering special perks to grantees or donors besides the Space DAOs already involved and more to be announced soon.

Confirmed grantees are companies mentioned before, as well as, [Orbuculum](https://dlteo.com/), [MoonSociety](https://www.moonsociety.org/), [Lunco](https://lunco.space/), Open Lunar Comms and many more to be confirmed soon.

## Objectives and Key Results: 
**Objective #1:** Conduct DeSpace QF Round on Gitcoin Grants Stack
**Key Results for Objective #1:** 
- Raise a minimum of $25k from sponsors.
- Draft Eligibility Criteria.
- Get at least 10 grantees on the platform.
- Facilitate the round.
- Plan and execute co-marketing.
- Build a DeSpace Cornerstone Fund for future Rounds

## Metrics to measure success: 
Matching Pool Fund size, number of grantees, number of donors, amount and number of donations, marketing engagement metrics, number of sponsors/advisors, cross-promotion activities by grantees.

## Founding Stewards: 
@ManuelOlariu
Manuel Olariu is the founder of DeepVenture.io and with Copernic Space he is building a space asset marketplace leading Innovation and IP standards. He is responsible for MoonDAO B2B while he is supporting various Decentralized Science and Decentralized Space activities. He led the last community-driven #GitcoinBeta Decentralized Science Grants Round utilizing Gitcoin's Grants Stack where MoonDAO played a critical part as the main initial sponsor of the Round.

@_Difint_
Rod Mamin is a systems engineer, with commercial experience building and sending robots to the Moon, Founder of LunCo.Space, Grantee on DeSci & Open Source Software Gitcoin’s GR15, Alpha Round, Beta Round and MoonDAOs Space Engineering Guild Initiator and Ex-Steward.

@PaulBurg_
Pavel Anisimov is an environmental scientist, with experience in public goods and decentralized communities. He is a Blockchain and space enthusiast and Founder of ReFi Phangan (GreenPill local chapter/ReFi DAO hub) and EcoSynthesisX

@Redotics
Red Boumghar is CEO of Parametry.ai, building SpaceDAO.AI with ESA, and graduated from Creative Destruction Lab.

@Adamjboyle
Adam Boyle is the founder of SpaceRoxDAO supporting public goods in Space and one of the Core members at Alpha Persei.

**Multi-sig Signers:**
@IonRod, @ManuelOlariu, @PaulBurg, @Red, @Adam @Ballack
oeth:0xde629289aBfDF973D3b845620Cf40F3c48c9627d

## Estimated Project Timeline: 
- **Aug 3, 2023:** Giveth page created.
- **Aug 15, 2023:** Min. 25k secured, first Round on Gitcoin announced.
- **Aug 29, 2023:** End of DeSpace Round.
- **Sep 15, 2023:** Sybill Analysis & Final results.
- **Sep 30, 2023:** Grantee Payouts.
- **Nov 1, 2023 / Ongoing:** Next DeSpace Round.

project.title: ReFi Medellín - Join the movement towards a more sustainable and equitable future in Medellín, Colombia
project.description:
# We are the movement towards a more sustainable and equitable future in #Medellín.

The goal of the node is to nurture community conversations around Web3 enabled regenerative-oriented-innovations (ROIs) and empower the youth in Medellín to address some of our city's most pressing challenges through hackathons, incubation, and investment. These challenges include poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to resource flows such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education.

## Brief explanation of this project:
With this project we will develop the ReFi understanding and with it we will improve the environmental and social impact that new ventures can have in the Region, creating a new focus for ReFi projects and understanding, helping us to grow economically without destroying our environment and our lives in the process. We also work hand in hand with ReFiDAO helping to onboard more people into the ReFi environment.

## Objective for this funding: 
We want to carry out onboarding activities so that more people learn about the ReFi movement and focus their projects on this path and philosophy.

With greater awareness of the existence of this type of projects and technologies, we are sure that they will add very well to the city's trend of new technology-based ventures, progressively creating a boom in ReFi companies in the region with global impact.

Our aim is to empower the youth in Medellín to address some of our city's most pressing challenges through hackathons, incubation, and investment. These challenges include poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to resource flows such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education.

## Budget
We intend to raise 28.200 USD that will be well spent to generate the following ambitious outcomes:

- Impact Onboarding Activity #1: 700 USD
- Impact Onboarding Activity #2: 700 USD
- Impact Onboarding Activity #3: 700 USD
- Impact Onboarding Activity #4: 700 USD
- Impact Onboarding Activity #5: 700 USD
- Impact Onboarding Activity #6: 700 USD

- ReFi Medellín Local Event #1: 1.000 USD
- ReFi Medellín Local Event #2: 1.000 USD
- ReFi Medellín Local Event #3: 1.000 USD

- Medellín Eternal Spring Activity #1: 1.500 USD
- Medellín Eternal Spring Activity #2: 1.500 USD

- Medellín Blockchain Community ReFi Workshop #1: 1.500 USD
- Medellín Blockchain Community ReFi Workshop #2: 1.500 USD

- ReFi Hackathon #1: 2.500 USD
- ReFi Hackathon #2: 2.500 USD

- Incubate and Invest One Social Entrepreneurship that come out from ReFi Medellín Hackathon #1: 5.000 USD
- Incubate and Invest One Social Entrepreneurship that come out from ReFi Medellín Hackathon #2: 5.000 USD

We believe that through ReFi Medellín, we can create a more socially inclusive and ecologically regenerative urbanism. Your support will enable us to make a significant impact on the lives of young people in our community, and we appreciate your donation.

project.title: ReFi Phangan
project.description:
Dear, community of public goods creators, donors, grantors and web3 users! I’m Paul, and I left my full time job in supply chain to regen full time and work in crossroad of web3, ecology-m & activism. I’m an environmental scientist and founder of ReFi Phangan community of public good builders. We are also advocating and promoting regenerative and sustainable life approaches with promoting of contribution in public goods. it fits perfectly with what we represent ReFi DAO and GreenPill as their local hub and local chapter respectively. 

Your support is important for all public good creators. Please choose projects you feel and contribute for common wealth. Let’s make it routine 

Problem Statement: We are facing critical environmental challenges, exacerbated by traditional business practices and a lack of effective solutions. These issues are particularly acute in areas like Koh Phangan, Thailand, where the ecosystem is under significant strain.

Our mission: Protect environment, educate community & implement web3 tools for public goods creator 

Our initiatives:

* Air quality Smart Bot

•in the vision -> an environmental consultant in your pocket with AQ report, recommendations and opportunity to chat with the bot for getting knowledge; 
•for now -> beta version with AQ report on koh Phangan in Twitter and report + recommendations on Telegram

* Tokenized solutions for public goods creators

•Implementation of plastic tokens solutions with blockchain verification and distribution on koh Phangan. Empower or Plastiks e.g;
•NFT as a decentralized capital redistribution mechanism to founding public goods. Onboarding local nonprofits into web3 with NFT game 

* Gamified Web3 Marketplace for public goods 
Users:
•Order from verified public good creators & sustainable service providers;
•Contribute for public goods;
•Get rewards for regenerative life practices
•Use OG NFT to get CONTRIBUTOR access for public goods 

Public good creators & service providers:
•Open your service providing point in our web3 marketplace;
•Get rewards for regenerative business practices;
•Get in touch with audience who cares;
•Get founding and support from contributors

* Events offline & online  with topics of advocating regenerative life practices , contributing to public goods and environmental protection 

•Live events for local community 
•Global online events via Community Calls and Spaces

* Paul Burg -> founder, plastic tokens/NFT/marketplace [in development]

* Max -> project manager support
* Arthur Picolo -> partnership support 
* Mark Golberg -> website v.1

* Leak of man power & funds

ReFI DAO pages and local hub ✅

AQSB alpha done ✅

project.title: ReFi Costa Rica: Regenerating our Optimism
project.description:
![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F78c67f18-fd76-4f28-8577-354cd792cb3d_1024x362.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")

## Welcome to ReFi Costa Rica!  Join us in the adventure of reconnecting all the people  regenerating our country, with our capital city San José at the center of a collaborative movement to transform Costa Rica into a ReFi Lab for the World.

For our second Gitcoin Round we need your support to consolidate [Verano ReFi Costa Rica 2023: Regenerating our Optimism](https://www.cambiatus.com/es/verano-refi)  an inspiring collection of ReFi events to share what is possible and what is already happening in ReFi in Costa Rica..

For our second Gitcoin Campaign we have a goal to raise $20k to make the full vision of Verano ReFi Costa Rica a reality!

[![IMAGE ALT TEXT HERE](http://img.youtube.com/vi/YOUTUBE_VIDEO_ID_HERE/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ai1KygCkTiE)


## Project Overview:

The ReFi Costa Rica Local Node project is dedicated to advancing regenerative finance and decentralized technology adoption in Costa Rica. With a special focus on areas beyond the capital city, San José, the project aims to foster a thriving ecosystem that promotes sustainable development, economic empowerment, and community engagement.

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fd2ad4fd8-761f-42c5-9489-c5441891cb2f_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")


## Project Goals and Impact:

+ _Local Engagement and Sustainable Development:_ The project seeks to introduce regenerative finance principles to regions such as Monteverde, Paraíso and Osa. By organizing events and workshops, it aims to showcase how decentralized technologies can drive sustainable economic growth while preserving the local environment and culture.
+ _Regional Empowerment:_ Through events in Monteverde, Paraíso and Osa, the project aims to empower local communities with innovative financial solutions. These solutions can align with regenerative practices, leading to the creation of sustainable livelihoods, businesses, and initiatives that benefit the region's unique characteristics.
+ _Community Collaboration:_ Collaborating with local partners, the project aims to facilitate collaboration among community members, organizations, and universities. By fostering a sense of shared purpose, it encourages the exchange of ideas, resources, and knowledge, leading to the creation of impactful regenerative projects.
+ _Inclusive Governance:_ In collaboration with [Cambiatus](https://www.cambiatus.com/), the project is committed to co-designing a governance framework that reflects the principles of regenerative finance. This framework aims to ensure inclusivity, transparency, and community-driven decision-making, enhancing the long-term sustainability of the local node.
+ _National and Global Integration:_ The project's vinculation with bigger events and organizations such as the II Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica during [Blockchain Jungle](https://blockchainjungle.com/) event and the Blockchain Week Costa Rica 2023 leadered by [AsoBlockchain](https://asoblockchain.org/) showcases the country's dedication to regenerative finance practices. Additionally, the involvement in the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon underscores Costa Rica's commitment to sharing insights on impactful governance and decision-making.
+ _Educational Advancement:_ Through collaborative master classes with [ULACIT](https://www.ulacit.ac.cr/) and [VIU](https://www.universidadviu.com/) universities, the project strives to educate students about the intersection of regenerative finance and decentralized technologies. By nurturing a skilled workforce, it aims to empower young minds to contribute to the sustainable development of Costa Rica's economy.


 
## Budget Breakdown:

Total Budget: $20,000

_**15% Event Planning and Execution:**_ Funding will be allocated to organize events in Monteverde, Osa and Paraíso, covering venue rentals, promotional materials, and logistical expenses. 

_**25% San José Event Collaborations:**_ Contributions towards monthly crypto meetups in partnership with AsoBlockchain, and organization of the II Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica during Blockchain Week Costa Rica 2023. 

_**10% Educational Workshops:**_ Costs associated with conducting master classes in collaboration with universities to educate the local community about blockchain technology. 

_**25% Governance Co-Design:**_ Allocation for collaborative efforts with Cambiatus to co-design an effective governance structure for the local node. 

_**25% ReFi DAO Event Participation:**_ Funding to attend the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon, representing Costa Rica and contributing insights to the global ReFi community. 



## Expected Outcomes:
+ Increased awareness and adoption of blockchain technology in Monteverde, Osa and Paraíso.
+ Stronger blockchain community engagement through San José events and collaborations with AsoBlockchain.
+ Enhanced knowledge and understanding of blockchain technology through educational master classes.
+ Well-defined and inclusive governance framework for the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node in collaboration with Cambiatus.
+ Meaningful contributions to the ReFi DAO event in Lisbon, elevating Costa Rica's presence and impact in the global ReFi community.

>**We invite you to be a part of this transformative journey by contributing to our campaign**. Your contribution will directly impact the growth and success of the ReFi Costa Rica Local Node and its endeavors. Together, we can drive regeneration, education, and innovation in Costa Rica's blockchain ecosystem.


## Results from Gitcoin Beta
For our Gitcoin Beta campaign we aimed to raise $50k to support “Verano ReFi” a series of events inside and outside San José and start working on our own website and learning path.  Considering the amount we raised with the mazing support from the Gitcoin Community and the ReFi DAO and Metacrisis matching funds (~ $5k) we decided to focus on one big event and a series of meetups to keep building our community, as well as creating content for social media and growing our following. 

## Events
We were able to organize and support the following events in San José, Costa Rica: 

1 One day event, our I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica.  +40 people attending, 8 projects presenting, 3 keynotes
7 Cripto Cantinas ReFi. Reach:  +140 people
3 events as guests: +95 people


**I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica (40 people attending)** 
On June 24th, 2023, the 1st ReFi Costa Rica 2023 Gathering took place in Barrio Escalante, San José. The event saw the participation of over 30 individuals and organizations who are driving regenerative finance initiatives from all corners of our country. The event was graced by the presence of Anna Kaic, representing ReFi DAO from Mexico, and was co-organized by Cambiatus, Gaia Impact, Sendero, and Diamante Bridge Collective – all founding organizations of ReFi Costa Rica. The event received support from AsoBlockchain Costa Rica.

[Luma Event](https://lu.ma/reficr-1enc?tk=PF8WHk) 
[Article on Substack](https://refisanjose.substack.com/p/i-encuentro-refi-costa-rica-2023)
Featured on [ReFi DAO.com blog](https://blog.refidao.com/visiting-refi-costa-rica/) thanks to [Anna Kaic](https://twitter.com/KaicAnna/status/1678500059652976642), who visited us from ReFi DAO to attend our event.


**Cripto Cantinas ReFi** (20 people attending per event approx.).  We joined forces with AsoBlockchain to support the weekly blockchain meetup in san José called Cripto Cantina. At least once a month, this meetup was focused on ReFi and facilitated by us: 

[**Criptocantina ReFi April (Topic: Gitcoin Beta)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1651297814557650945)

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #1 (Topic: Intro to ReFi Costa Rica and our projects)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1653896427636965376)

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #2 (Topic: Cripto Orosi pre-launch)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1659678250002440193) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi May #3 (Topic: Collaborative Businesses with CofiBlocks)**](https://twitter.com/AsoBlockchainCR/status/1663277334605037568) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi June (Topic:  Pre-event  I Encuentro ReFi Costa Rica)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1672334136608956416) 

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi July (Topic: Open Mic of local projects)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689797122323841024)  

[**Cripto Cantina ReFi August  (Topic:  Governance, Decision Making and Redistribution)**](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689802358614618112) 


**Events from other collectives that we supported:** 
Evento de Cripto Orosi (out of San José) (40pax)
[Master Class at ULACIT University](https://twitter.com/ReFiCostaRica_/status/1689798574404472832) (15pax)
Bitcoin Pizza Day May 25th (40pax)  [Speakers](https://twitter.com/hemp_pizza/status/1656378018653253633) 
[Video](https://twitter.com/hemp_pizza/status/1663179445170044929)

## Content
We also were able to create and strengthen our presence in social media and to host two episodes of the Pura Vida Hour, a twitter space showcasing the people and projects behind ReFi Costa Rica. We also supported the ReFi Latam community as co-hosts of its twitter space Espacios Latam.

[**Linktree and Social media**](https://linktr.ee/reficostarica)
[**Substack**](https://refisanjose.substack.com/)
[**Pura Vida Hour (online event / Twitter space)**](https://refisanjose.substack.com/p/pura-vida-hour-first-two-episodes) 
[**Espacios Latam**](https://twitter.com/ReFiLatinAmeric)


## Our numbers:  
275 people attending our events
53 members on Telegram
365 Followers:  Tw, Linkedin, substack, youtube
92 people connected + 219 reproductions of Pura Vida Hour (twitter space)

## The amazing people behind ReFi San José

Behind this campaign there is a group of motivated, seasoned and committed founders with years of experience in regenerative practices, community building, innovation, impact, blockchain technology, fundraising; and deeply connected with corporate, academic, government, civil and grassroots organizations in Costa Rica and Latam.

**Core Team Members**

1. Karla Córdoba Brenes, Cambiatus Co-Founder, Asoblockchain Vicepresident / Community Building, content creation, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
2. Danielle Gennety, Diamante Bridge Collective / Community Building
3. Ronny Castillo, Gaia Impact / Fundación Madre Tierra Verde, investment vehicles codesign, funding strategies, tokenomics.  
4. Melissa Rivera Abarca, Fundación Madre Tierra Verde / innovation and community building.
5. Ranulfo Paiva Sobrinho, Cambiatus Co-Founder / Community Building, Social Currencies and DAOs co-design
6. Randall Saborío, Diamante Bridge Collective / eco-villages and local markets
7. Pedro García, Sendero-Jardín de Lolita / Community Building, culture


**Community Members / Founders**

1. Lila Behr, ReFi Researcher, solutions communicator.
2. Agustín Matteri, United Species DAO / Locally-led Climate Resilience Strategist / Node activities in Nicoya bioregion landscape-ecosystem.
3. Lorena Erbure Cardozo, Ruta Ruda Co-Founder / social and conservation projects / cybersecurity
4. Omar Hurtado, CofiBlocks Co-Founder / Tourism and Coffee Production
5. Irene González Chen, Verdes Monteverde Coordinator / Journalist and Activist
6. Alejandro Solís, BIOTA / Ecosystem services, Member of CRUSA community
7. Miranda, QUÉ CIUDAD / Co-Founder / social investment/ environmental performance
8. Francisco Grau, Nangu / Land regeneration
9. Charlotte Fradet, Unity Co-living, urban co-living spaces
10. Roxana Zamora, CriptoversePlax


## **Join us in regenerating our optimism and making a meaningful difference!**

![photo ReFiCosta Rica](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_webp,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fsubstack-post-media.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F82b0072e-a1c5-46b7-9433-963aa7c74fbe_1024x683.jpeg "group shot refi costa rica")

project.title: ReFi Geneva
project.description:
Geneva is recognized as the "diplomatic capital of the world" due to its hosting of various international organizations including the UN's European headquarters, the World Health Organization, the International Labour Organization, the World Trade Organization, the International Telecommunication Union. 

These entities contribute significantly to addressing global challenges and promoting international collaboration. This is why we believe in the importance of launching a local node and promote regenerative agriculture practices here.

The needs to improve the ongoing initiatives are many, but the most important ones are uncorrelated communities solving humanitarian, climate and food security issues, which are all very entangled and deserve a neutral place to connect, open dialogues and implements regenerative practices on the ground together.

I see an opportunity to bridge the ReFi community with the international organizations making efforts on these issues but lacking grounded and capable people to execute on solving locally proven experiments that need the backing to scale internationally.

project.title: ReFi Paramaribo | Innovators Buzz: An innovative community rooted in regeneration & technology
project.description:
# **ReFi Paramaribo: An innovative community rooted in regeneration and technology**

ReFi Paramaribo, part of Innovators Buzz, aims to empower local individuals and organizations to come together and create a more sustainable and equitable future by providing a co-working space, resources, education, impact projects and networking opportunities for local innovation actors. 

**Catalyze a regenerative future in Suriname** 🌱 **Become a contributor for ReFi Paramaribo today!**

As Suriname's economy has been spiraling downwards for years, and traditional financial systems have failed to address the root causes of this issue. We believe that a regenerative finance approach, which prioritizes creating positive social impact and environmental outcomes, can help to address these challenges and generate more resilient opportunities in Suriname.

![Innoveren voor het Klimaat, Innovators Buzz](https://imagizer.imageshack.com/img924/5762/brNAF9.jpg)

ReFi Paramaribo connects local change makers and innovators to a network of like-minded individuals, resources, and opportunities to turn ideas into reality, for a more sustainable and positive future for Suriname.

Funds acquired during GG18 will be used to cover the costs of salaries/stipend, hosting networking events, providing educational resources, offering support for local innovative projects, and providing a co-working space equipped with all necessary amenities for our members. Any additional funds will be used to expand our reach and impact through marketing and outreach efforts.

Here are some of our upcoming projects:
- Food for Tomorrow: [Document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1km7fDG2BITpqyEXfCysY5uI1mVawK018416EOUU97n8/edit?usp=sharing)
- "Dobru" & "Growth Guides": [Document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/11Y3O3YJwJBrpJDYSPLdk8duU8MC6bddzSIgTopmOe8w/edit?usp=sharing)

Our success will be measured by the number of individuals and organizations that are able to access resources and support through our network, as well as the impact of the projects and initiatives that we support.

![Innoveren voor het Klimaat, Innovators Buzz](https://imagizer.imageshack.com/img924/6382/y9lz4J.jpg)

Our team consists of:

**Timothy Goudzand**
*Co-Founder at Infinitri*
[Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/goudzandt), [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/timgoudzand/)

project.title: ReFi Lisboa — a regenerative startup society in a top web3 city
project.description:
As a part of an evolving network of coordiNATIONs, ReFi Lisboa is cultivating a regenerative startup society in one of Europe’s top web3 cities here in Lisbon, Portugal. Based on the core belief that we need to heal the world within in order to heal the world around us, we are bringing together regenerative technology, art, music, design, and economics to create a new culture in the capital of this beautiful country here in Portugal.

In November, we’ll host the inaugural gathering of regenerative startup societies—bringing key local and international leaders together to explore how we can fulfill a single unifying mission:

*Regenerate the earth using the most powerful tools of our time.*

![annual-meeting-portugal-narrow.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/521w124n/annual-meeting-portugal-narrow.jpg)

## ReFi Annual Meeting — Gathering of Regen CoordiNATIONs

After hosting 10 events and reaching over 700 leaders across public, private, and third-sector institutions, we’re taking our next step forward by hosting the ReFi Annual Meeting and inviting local and global leaders of regenerative coordiNATIONS to gather for the first ‘Davos of ReFi’ on Nov 6-7 in a prestigious city center location on the day after ETHLisbon.

[REQUEST AN INVITE](https://tally.so/r/nGKZPe) 💌

---

## Gitcoin GG18 ambitions

We are aiming to raise $7500 in GG18 to continue to onboard talent and capital into the regenerative economy via web3 rails. This funding will be spread across three key initiatives:

- **Monthly events (x3):** $3000
- **Community & growth:** $4200
- **Onboarding stations:** $300

**Total:** $7500

---

![refi-lisboa-july-group.jpeg](https://i.postimg.cc/yNp9FhFb/refi-lisboa-july-group.jpg)

### Recap from Gitcoin Beta

Thanks to the $3680 we received from Gitcoin Beta along with support from [Celo](celo.org), [Polygon](https://polygon.technology/) and [DFINITY](https://dfinity.org/), we’ve been able to host 5 events, reaching over 328 leaders across web3, finance and impact. In partnership with [African Data Tech](https://www.africandata.tech/) and [Positive Blockchain](https://positiveblockchain.io/) we seeded [an initial directory app](https://ling478.preview.softr.app/) of the key people and projects of the regenerative society in Lisbon through an integration with [Catalist.network](http://Catalist.network). We also hosted our first [Gitcoin Activation Station](https://www.notion.so/How-to-host-an-activation-station-71c1676071444f7e930deec0672b3812?pvs=21) and created an open source guide as apart of the ReFi DAO Local Node Toolkit!

---

## Our vision

We aim to balance the power of technology with conscious awareness by establishing a physical network of regenerative leaders and spaces across various sectors and problem areas. We are bringing together public, private, and third-sector institutions, as well as thought leaders in environmental, ecological, social, and cultural domains.

We see ourselves as an accelerator for the regenerative economy embedded within existing institutions to help them harness the power of regeneration and work towards a prosperous future for all.

![workshop-refi-night](https://i.postimg.cc/9X6d8Bv3/workshop-refi-night.jpg)

## Meet the team

- Emilie Viallon - People Lead & Events
- John Ellison — Source Steward
- Laura Malta — Events & Community Lead
- Susanne Zapelão — Marketing
- Rica Amaral — Partnerships & Events
- Emiliano Gutiérrez - Product

## Advisors

- Carolina Carvalho — Ecosystem Mapping
- Eduardo Marques — Strategy & Partnerships
- Tariq El Haj Omar — Regenerative Project Development
- River Roberts — Regenerative Real Estate

## Technology is key

We believe that technology encompasses not only hardware and software, but also the incredible low-tech solutions that have existed for millennia, such as meditation, yoga, breath work, plants, and various forms of medicine.

Join us. 🙏🏼

## 2023 OKRs 🗓

For the next 6 months, we want to achieve the following:

1. Identify 2-3 land-based regenerative projects as a pilot for project development 🏜
2. Release a hard-copy of ‘Lisboa Regenerativa’ and distribute it to 10,000 Lisboetas and tourists via local shops, cafes, restaurants, and tour providers 📔
3. Announce a formal partnership with NOVA University, the University of Lisbon, and the City of Lisbon Municipality—hosting our first event together 🏫
4. Host three volunteer days serving homeless, orphans, and refugees as a community.  🥗👨‍👩‍👧‍👧
5. Spread the story of regeneration. ♥️☀️🤗

![plsd_prw-87.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/XY89v6X3/sheep-dj.jpg)
🐑 We love sheep... who doesn't?

## Finances

As of today, all funds are managed by a [multi-sig on Ethereum](https://app.safe.global/settings/setup?safe=eth:0x728b09639453F3047E36D063C64C91b3871aFD92) and an [Open Collective account](https://opencollective.com/refi-lisboa) thanks to support from [all4climate](https://twitter.com/all4climatedao)!

## Every DAI counts!
Whether you're based in Lisbon permanently or just plan on swinging through, we'd be incredibly grateful to receive your support in GG18!

See you on the other side Regen! 🤙

ReFi Prague is a recently launched local node of ReFi DAO in the Czech Republic, with the aim to build and expand the local eco-community, and to help fund and support local regenerative projects, such as eco-villages, permaculture projects, vertical farms, community gardens, community-supported agriculture programs (CSAs) and similar.

https://spoluzemevrabsko.cz/home/
https://divocinamalesov.cz/
https://www.zemesouzneni.cz/en/
https://zabrehem.cz/

Starting with a capital raised from this Gitcoin round, our node envisions further funding through crowdfunding and private investments. By fostering an ecosystem of collaboration, the project aims to ensure the long-term viability of sustainable ventures.

https://mirror.xyz/daliborcerny.eth

We foster collaboration between many local individuals and entities, recognizing the importance of tighter connections between the public and private sectors.

Our ultimate goal is creation and innovation in line with the principles of nature, which includes biomimicry approaches and designs, building of supportive networks, sharing, and striving for personal happiness of everyone involved.

project.title: ReFi Tanzania
project.description:
TL;DR:
We are seeking funding through this Gitcoin grant to establish a Regenerative Finance local node in Tanzania. Our project focuses on creating a waste regeneration system that integrates blockchain technology to address environmental challenges and promote sustainable finance practices with waste pickers at the heart of it all. We invite you to support our initiative to make a positive impact on both the environment and local communities.

Introduction:
Our project aims to establish a Regenerative Finance local node in Tanzania, with a focus on waste regeneration and blockchain integration. By combining innovative waste management strategies with the transparency and security of blockchain technology, we intend to contribute to a more sustainable and regenerative future.

Problem Statement:
Tanzania, like many other regions, faces significant challenges related to waste management and environmental degradation. Improper disposal of waste contributes to pollution, health hazards, and ecological damage. Waste pickers are the ones that do all the off-setting however face many challenges such as lack of resources, negative societal stigma, and most importantly exploitation in pay where they receive a mere $0.1 per kilogram of waste! Additionally, the lack of transparent financial systems often hinders sustainable development efforts. Our project addresses these issues by creating a waste regeneration system that not only reduces waste but also provides economic incentives through blockchain-powered finance mechanisms.

Project Solution:
Our project's core solution involves the establishment of a waste regeneration system that transforms waste materials into valuable resources. By leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Blockchain, dmrv and efficient recycling processes, we aim to minimize waste accumulation and its negative impact on the environment. Furthermore, we integrate blockchain technology to ensure transparent tracking of waste transformation processes and provide financial rewards to participants who contribute to the system.

Project Goals:
- Environmental Regeneration: Reduce waste accumulation, minimize pollution, and promote sustainable resource management.
- Blockchain Integration & Onboarding to Web3: Implement a secure and transparent blockchain system to track waste regeneration processes, decentralized storage onboard waste pickers to web3 directly and incentivize participants.
- Community Engagement: Raise awareness about waste-related issues and involve local communities in waste management and regeneration efforts as well as how they can benefit from sustainable practices in the form of carbon credits, tokenizing of Real world Assets and much more.


We are looking to revive the machinery at our incubated site to increase capacity and production of these eco-products such as eco-spare parts for Rickcshaws, eco-tiles and eco-bricks which will help add additionality to our project to enable it to receive quality carbon credits which will eventually raise the basic income of our waste pickers from a mere 0.1$ per kilogram of plastic waste.

Examples of our eco products include eco-spare parts for Rickshaws, eco-tiles and eco-bricks which are massively needed to support local Tanzanians and their small businesses. 



The Team:

Our team consists of dedicated individuals with diverse expertise:
- David Machuche from Chatafisha, Project Lead: A professional with deep knowledge of local ecological challenges, Regenerative Finance, financial inclusion and Web3 for real world use cases. 
- Victor Muhagachi from Chatafisha, Strategy and Web3 for local communities: An experienced strategy designer, blockchain developer specializing in onboarding local communities to Web3 in broken down Swahili terminologies.
- Eng. Allen from Zaidi Recyclers Kimambo, Environmental Scientist: A waste management expert with over 10 years experience and a background in sustainable development.
- Teresia Mhaiki Community Outreach Coordinator: A communication specialist focusing on community engagement, specifically in environment and sustainability.

Budget:
- Technology Development: $10,000 for decentralized app that will contain sub wallets for waste pickers, track credit scores with blockchain integration.
- Infrastructure & Plant: $20,000 for setting up waste regeneration facilities and community engagement centers.
- Logistics for waste: $2,000 for reallocating the waste from collection points to recyclers.
- Awareness Campaign & Events: $2,000 for educational workshops, awareness programs, and community training.

Call to Action:
We invite you to contribute to our mission of creating a more regenerative and sustainable future in Tanzania. By supporting our project, you will play a crucial role in addressing waste management challenges, promoting eco-friendly practices, and fostering transparent financial systems. Your donation will have a lasting positive impact on the environment, local communities, and the overall well-being of the region. Together, we can drive meaningful change and lead the way towards a more sustainable and prosperous Tanzania!

Our address is 0x037Eb04AD9DDFf984F44Ce5941D14b8Ea3781459

Image link for the process on how it will work: https://postimg.cc/KRwMn9Sx

project.title: ReFi Hong Kong, a top community in Asia to connect ESG and ReFi
project.description:
# Our Vision: Raise awareness of stakeholders on ESG and carbon neutrality through Regenerative Finance and web3 technology.

Our vision for ReFi Hong Kong is to create a transformative paradigm that merges environmental, social, and governance (ESG) principles with cutting-edge web3 technology. By doing so, we aim to raise awareness among stakeholders about the importance of ESG factors and carbon neutrality, ultimately fostering a regenerative economy that prioritizes sustainability and positive impact.

Considering our main focus is raising awareness, we believe that by leveraging ReFi and web3 technology, we can effectively educate stakeholders about ESG principles and carbon neutrality, make ESG strategy easier and more attractive. Through innovative financial mechanisms and web3, we will empower and incentivize individuals, businesses, and organizations to understand and actively participate in sustainable practices. By highlighting the interconnectedness between financial decisions and the environment, society, and governance, we can foster a mindset shift towards regenerative approaches.

Thus, emphasizing on transformative potential of ReFi, by harnessing the power of web3 technology, we envision a financial ecosystem that promotes transparency, traceability, and accountability. Through these mechanisms, we aim to catalyze the transition towards a carbon-neutral economy in Hong Kong, where businesses and individuals actively contribute to the regeneration of natural resources and the enhancement of social well-being.

# Our Mission:

Based on the innovation of Web3 in technical and financial field, the ReFi DAO HONG KONG could help various stakeholders (government, WEB3 enthusiast, financial institutions and family offices and etc.) included but not limited:
- To achieve their own carbon neutrality, and to implement innovative methods to practise the CONCEPT of NET ZERO.
- To explore opportunities on ESG, green and sustainable finance field
- To wake up public awareness of ESG
- To accelerate the youth-led education in web3 and regenerative-oriented field.

# Background: The Opportunity in Hong Kong

Hong Kong's government has recently taken a proactive stance in supporting the growth of the crypto and Web3 industries by creating a safe space for companies to operate. 

The government has launched a new policy initiative called "Hong Kong: Asia's World City for Crypto & Blockchain," which aims to promote the city as a leading hub for these technologies. This initiative will provide a regulatory framework that balances innovation and investor protection, fostering a stable and safe environment for companies to operate.

The Hong Kong government is also showing a strong commitment to ESG. In 2019, the government launched the Green Finance Certification Scheme, which encourages financial institutions to develop green finance products and services, and provides certification to those that meet certain criteria. The government has also set a target of reducing Hong Kong's carbon intensity by 65-70% by 2030, compared to 2005 levels, and has implemented various policies and initiatives to promote renewable energy and efficiency. In addition, Hong Kong has been a signatory to the UN-supported Principles for Responsible Investment since 2016, and the government has recently launched a new initiative to promote sustainable finance in the city.

# Challenges From ESG to ReFi

ReFi is the next evolution of ESG. Rather than simply reducing harm, ReFi aims to support regenerative practices that restore and improve ecosystems and communities. Additionally, finance instruments can empower regenerative solutions with efficiency and scalability. 

Still, lack of self-awareness among individuals and communities regarding the value of ReFi is the key challenges for the Hong Kong local node. The society is in the early stages of seeing a thriving regeneration and web3 ecosystem emerge, and local communities are skeptical about how effective ReFi could be in tackling climate challenge. We cooperate with several initiatives such as Carbonbase, Arkreen, BTC Club and interact proactively with local investment communities. These initiatives offer a solid foundation for the ReFi Hong Kong community to build upon and create a network of like-minded individuals and organizations committed to regenerative finance and sustainable investment. 

Although the prospects of ReFi in HongKong is bright and brilliant, the path is hard and tortuous. We are facing some realistic challenges. Convincing the highly discerning communities that are raised in an international and developed society is not an easy job, we need to keep constant visiting, impressing them with detailed cases and work, such as arranging high-quality roundtable meetings, exhibitions and other activities. All these brings financial callenges for us and we wholeheartedly appreciate the granting from government, academia and of course, the web3 community like you.

# Action: 1st Online Twitter Space Talk:

27th July 2023, ReFi Hong Kong organized the 1st online Twitter Space Talk. Hosting by ReFi Hong Kong contributor, we invited 4 speakers from different industry (Carbon World, RGRT, New Energy Nexus & Allinfra) to share their exploration and practice of ESG and ReFi in Hong Kong.

![ ReFi Hong Kong organized the 1st online Twitter Space Talk]( https://cdn.discordapp.com/ephemeral-attachments/1092492867185950852/1140845568046932008/Online_Twitter_Space_Talk.png)

# We intend to raise: 5,000 USD that will be well spent to generate the following ambitious outcomes by the end of 2023:

# Your donations will help make this all possible! 

## 1. *Engage the local community: 2,000 USD*
- Host Twitter Space Talks 
- Host at least 2 offline events in H2 2023. (Meetup is always the most effective way to gathering people together to DO something SPECIAL:).) 
- These events will invite expert/guest speakers in ReFi, Web3, and ESG in Hong Kong.
- The cost may used in venue rental and refreshment arrangement. 

## 2. *Education is essential to building a regenerative future. 2,000 USD*
- Partner with universities to do some projects together.
- Arrange workshops/seminars to educate young generation on ESG and ReFi
- The cost may used in venue rental and refreshment arrangement. 

## 3. *Promotion and advertisement: 500 USD*
- To promote the event like create posters, banners, and etc.

## 4. *Human resources: 500 USD*
- Core team members need to be meetups regularly to discuss the coming activities organization 
- Host monthly meetings on the third Tuesday of every month, to align with all the contributors what we have done and what we will do.

# Impact by the end of 2023

Ideally, we would like to increase the members of ReFi Hong Kong from 33 to 100 in telegram. Reach the followers from 89 to 150 in Twitter. Through organizing offline events, to involve more young people from university into the community.
 
# Who we are!

## - We are a group of founders, builders, contributors, climate activists, ESG practitioners, engineers...
## - We are a community of people who are crazy about ESG and ReFi. 
## - All of us are volunteers, joining in ReFi DAO Hong Kong to make a contribution on regenerate our earth.
## - We firmly believe that although the power of an individual is small, the power of a group of people is unlimited.

project.title: Empowering Regenerative Entrepreneurship in Altos Mirandinos
project.description:
We aim to democratize regenerative entrepreneurship in Altos Mirandinos through education, networking, and technological empowerment. By leveraging blockchain technology and the ReFi framework, the project seeks to unite local producers, farmers, and entrepreneurs to create sustainable economic opportunities and promote positive social change.

**Welcome to the Venezuela ReFi Node efforts, welcome to regeneration**

Los Altos Mirandinos, a vibrant hub with diverse industries and unique challenges, stands next to the capital of Venezuela. Despite hyperinflation and complex market conditions, the city possesses immense entrepreneurial potential. This project's goal is to harness this potential by creating a regenerative ecosystem through education, networking, and blockchain-powered innovation.

**The Role of Twist Studio Creativo:**
Twist Studio Creativo, a pioneering community center, will spearhead this project. We believe that regenerative entrepreneurship is the way forward for Venezuela, focusing on sustainability, social impact, and equitable economic growth. Our extensive network of entrepreneurs and professionals will serve as a catalyst for meaningful change.

**Refi Spring Grant and Bootcamp:**
Having received the Refi Spring Grant, we initiated the ReFi Bootcamp – a cornerstone event that educates local producers, entrepreneurs, and farmers about blockchain, sustainability, and regenerative business models. This bootcamp introduced participants to the transformative power of Web3 technology. These same people will be the first to benefit from this project and become multipliers of the ReFi movement. 

The Problem and Solution:
Venezuela’s diverse landscape houses both global corporations and sprawling slums. We aim to bridge this gap through education, networking, and technological integration. By using blockchain, we democratize access to data, fostering collaboration and equitable AI development. Our project focuses on regenerative entrepreneurship as an alternative path to economic growth, mitigating hyper-consumerism and revitalizing sustainable practices.

**The Project's Goal:**
Our primary objective is to unite local producers, farmers, and entrepreneurs with regenerative insights and experiences to create a certification of single-origin and coffee quality. Through education and mentorship, we aim to empower individuals with the knowledge and tools to build sustainable businesses.

**How will we do it?**

We count on a strong community that has already been onboarded on ReFi and is committed to the mission. Among these we have the brothers Barrios, third generation of coffee growing in the region, and Jannina Pójan leader of the International Women’s Coffee Alliance (IWCA), also known as @thecoffeeteacher. Using their leverage with a larger community of more than 150 producers we will multiply our previous work with the ReFi Bootcamp and continue to grow as a large ReFi community. 

Our first milestone will be to organize a series of different onboarding activities to make each of these members actively engage in Web3 and ReFi. 

Also among our community leaders, we have Osiris Ostia @Biosirisnatural an activist agriculture engineer that works to bring a more sustainable approach to the region with Mr Apolinares, a descendant of natives who proudly brings real empirical experience on how to restore our ecosystems. They will be in charge of the field training to provide fundamental applicable tools to our producers. 

Finally, we will utilize collected data and standardized procedures to create our first NFTs and recognition to the community. Their final product (Coffee and products) will be accompanied by digital proof of their impact and sustainable methods. 

For the development of on-chain reputation certificates with NFTs and the trust-building process with the Web3 and Sustainability communities, we count on our friends of TrustedSeed and our local organizations as Corporation B Venezuela. 

**The Team:**

**Susana González:** An adept storyteller and networker, dedicated to Web3 sustainability at ImpactScope. With a background in fostering relationships in the entrepreneurship community, Susana brings an innovative perspective.


**Daniel Alejandro Knobelsdorf:** Founder of Transience Labs and a key player in Ethereum Venezuela, SingularityU Caracas, and more. Daniel brings a wealth of experience in blockchain technology and entrepreneurship.


**María Fernanda Cordova:** A community builder and Ed-tech advocate, María champions innovative education initiatives. Her expertise in leadership and social impact is a valuable asset.

**Budget:**

- Training (Bootcamps, mentoring sessions): $3,000
- Field training: $2,000
- Development of on-chain reputation certificate with NFTs  $1,000
- Incentives as microcredit: $1,000

We invite you to be a part of this transformative journey by contributing to our grant. Your support will enable us to empower local entrepreneurs, create sustainable opportunities, and foster positive change in Venezuela. 

 "Those who are entrepreneurs in Venezuela are seeking to regenerate it." Hence, the ReFi business model naturally aligns with the country's current needs. Venezuela, a nation in need of regeneration, stands to gain numerous benefits from ReFi, as do other countries facing similar circumstances.


**Donate Today to Empower Regenerative Entrepreneurship in Los Altos Mirandinos!**

project.title: ReFi London — Convening Leaders of Change.
project.description:
### **Overview**

At the crossroads of entrepreneurship, finance, and world-leading institutions lies London— a city teeming with talent, capital, and a history of leading change. Against this backdrop, ReFi London is emerging with a clear purpose: to bring together the city's unparalleled strengths and channel them towards building a sustainable, regenerative future.

With your support, this grant will be the seed from which we build this community. We will offer events & meetups for leaders to converge, develop a comprehensive map of local regenerative projects, and support Regens Unite London. Together, we will make London a leading light in the global regenerative economy movement.

### **Background**

The roots of ReFi London are embedded in the global ambition of ReFi DAO—a vision to cultivate a worldwide regenerative economy through a network of interconnected local communities known as ‘Local Nodes’. ReFi London aspires to be a beacon among these Nodes, rallying high-impact leaders and leveraging London's leadership in finance, entrepreneurship, technology, and academia for positive change.

### **Key Activities Supported by this Grant:**

**35% - Support for Regens Unite London:** Bolster the efforts of Regens Unite London by providing financial sponsorship and active participation to further our shared missions of uniting the regenerators of London. This will serve as the kickoff for ReFi London with a collaborative workshop to convene stakeholders in co-creating this new organisation.

**25 % -** **ReFi London Knowledge Graph & Website:** Fuel the development of the ReFi London Knowledge Graph and the accompanying website. This platform will serve as a comprehensive map of London's regenerative economy ecosystem and local projects. It will empower members with the data, connections, and insights they need to catalyze meaningful change and serve as a key first step for going on to actively support local regenerative initiatives (e.g. community/city farms, local cooperatives, re-wilding initiatives etc..)

**40% - ReFi London Summit & Events Fund**: Half of the grant will be channelled towards an Events Fund in preparation for the ReFi London Summit and other upcoming events. Recognizing London's unparalleled position as a hub of talent and innovation, these events aim to attract the best of the public, private, and third-sector leaders beyond the immediate bubble of Web3 & ReFi. With your support, we can ensure these events reach their full potential, making them the cornerstone of our community-building efforts, networking opportunities, and knowledge exchange with policymakers and think tanks.

Through the allocation of the grant's funds to these core activities, we are poised to set in motion a transformative wave of initiatives that fortify London's position as a pioneer in regenerative finance and sustainable practices. Every penny will be used judiciously, ensuring that we not only meet but exceed our objectives in making London a leading light in the global regenerative economy movement.

### **Join Us!**

ReFi London is a call to leaders, innovators, and changemakers to step forward and coalesce their efforts towards a common goal: a regenerative future. In this era of unprecedented challenges, the solution lies in unity, collaboration, and a shared vision. Support ReFi London, be part of the revolution, and let's together sculpt the regenerative economy of tomorrow 🌱

project.title: Tulum’s Tomorrow, Accelerating the Regenaissance with ReFi Tulum
project.description:
### Tulum’s Tomorrow: Accelerating the Regenaissance with ReFi Tulum

ReFi Tulum is an instrumental force driving positive change for Mexico and the world, embracing the two key pillars of **circular economies** and **regenerative tourism** to shape a sustainable, equitable future for generations to come. Our vision focuses on innovation, community engagement, women's empowerment, and impactful storytelling to ignite the "Regenaissance."


[![tulumbeach.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/0Qh8Xct0/tulumbeach.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/KkrSRrh1)
## Why Circularity and Tourism?

The world is at a pivotal point, demanding a paradigm shift towards circular economies and regenerative practices. Tulum, with its pristine beaches, lush landscapes, and vibrant culture, has captured the hearts of travelers, digital nomads, and expats from around the globe. However, its popularity has come at a cost; the growth of the population and influx of millions of visitors have put a strain on its fragile ecosystems, infrastructure, and cultural heritage.

Tulum's allure is deeply rooted in its natural beauty and rich heritage. By adopting circular economies and regenerative tourism, we're not only preserving these unique attributes but enhancing them. Our innovative initiatives bring together tourists, local communities, and businesses in a collective effort to restore and protect Tulum's environment. This approach goes beyond sustainability; it ensures Tulum thrives for generations to come.

### Circular Economies through Innovation: Technology and Incentivization

With our core partner, [Petgas](https://www.petgas.com.mx/), we're leading the charge in the de-plastification of the planet, leveraging existing technology solutions to address a lack of waste disposal options especially prevalent in Mexico, as well as impacting humanity around the world. Our mission is clear: to embrace circular economies and regenerative tourism as pivotal strategies that will shape a sustainable and equitable future for generations to come.

**Plastic pollution is a global crisis**, and ReFi Tulum is committed to addressing it head-on. Here's how we're tackling this critical issue through **Web3 incentivization, Education, and Innovation**:

- **Web3 Incentivization**: We're harnessing the power of blockchain tech and Web3 to incentivize and reward individuals for their active participation and “mining” of plastic waste from the environment.
  - Through a measurement and rewards system powered by a mobile app, we want to change the way people, both tourists and locals, see plastic, from a waste into a resource. They will see their wallets gain tokens with each plastic drop-off and successful plastic weigh-in.
  - We plan to use NFTs to fund investments in plants, machinery, measurement, and logistics to start the circular flow of waste to sellable products and passive income streams for holders. NFTs can be used in a multitude of ways from plastic traceability and measurement to rewards for actions such as POAPs, and many types of membership structures that provide access to machinery and other benefits.

[![jaguarplasticbeach.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/g22K4D17/jaguarplasticbeach.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/D8RswqvQ)

-**Education** ReFi Tulum is deeply committed to fostering education and awareness as cornerstones of our mission. We intend to cultivate a learning ecosystem that spans various dimensions of sustainability, regenerative practices, and plastic waste management. Through workshops, training sessions, and engaging experiences, we will empower local communities, tourists, and children with knowledge about responsible plastic use, circular economies, and the significance of the Blue Circular Economy. 

- **Innovation - Thermoformation for New Products:** Through thermoformation technology, ReFi Tulum plans to transform plastic into a variety of usable resellable products, from furniture and building materials to plastic collection bins. This process not only addresses plastic waste but also supports our self-sustainability, as the repurposed plastic contributes to our operations and initiatives.
[![tf100.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/50XvD9Jd/tf100.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/XG0pCbXQ)

- **Measurement**
In our commitment to tackle plastic pollution, we have implemented a beginner system of measurement and traceability. For instance, each plastic jaguar collector, when filled, holds 12 kg of plastic waste. At the National Beach jaguar zone, the placement of 3 of these collectors results in the collection of 36 kg every 5 days. This cumulative effort, amounting to 180 kg per month, effectively neutralizes significant amounts of plastic waste. This measurement and traceability approach ensures the tangible impact of our initiatives in combating plastic pollution.

[![tracking.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/KjDSKFkG/tracking.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/kRGhZ0vz)
Through these innovative strategies and collaborations, we can lead the charge in deplastifying the planet. By leveraging technology and aligning incentive structures, we can turn the tide against plastic pollution, and showcase that success to inspire others around the world.

## Regenerative Tourism Movement to Clean, Restore, and Transform

The **ReFi Tulum Regenerative Tourism** initiative aims to reimagine Tulum's tourism industry by shifting from a focus on sustainability to regenerative practices. By engaging tourists, businesses, and local communities, we aspire to create a thriving and resilient destination that preserves and enhances Tulum's natural and cultural heritage for generations to come. We believe Tulum and the surrounding area offer the right and necessary conditions to be a successful model to the world of how to regeneratively develop a tourism industry that not only mitigates its negative impacts but actively contributes to the restoration, preservation, and thriving of both the natural environment and local communities, setting a powerful example for global destinations seeking a more responsible and regenerative approach to tourism.

Tulum's Riviera, known for its exquisite natural splendor, ancestral heritage, and magnetic allure, serves as the canvas to illustrate tales of regeneration. These experiential narratives not only profoundly impact travelers but also leave enduring, regenerative imprints on the very places they explore. We want to shift tourism from exploitative to one of rejuvenation, all while targeting the critical global issue of plastic waste.
[![milagros.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/6QDLWNTs/milagros.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/67fGcgdz)
## Our Vision: Immersive Regenerative Experiences

Our goal is to develop immersive and educational experiences that provide visitors with an opportunity to actively participate in regenerative activities such as beach cleanups, ecosystem restoration, and sustainable agriculture. This will also provide an opportunity to showcase local Mexican projects to the world for greater visibility, growth, and project acceleration. Using regenerative tourism to create a collective effort to regenerate and protect Tulum's ecosystem.

### Experiences

Engage in IRL (in real life) utility of web3 planet positive collections such as the House of Panther, Restore Coral, CocoCoin.club, Entre Monedas, Maya Spirits, Crypto Papaya, and many others in regenerative land cultivation and other ReFi companies that are using web3 to accelerate positive change. We will develop experiences as well as a 7 or 8-day road trip that visits the best examples of ReFi in the area.

### Collaborative Restoration

Work with local groups and government agencies to develop scalable mangrove planting and jungle restoration operations and attract global organizations for large scale planting activities.
[![siankaanmangrove.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/25MFkL28/siankaanmangrove.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/XZKyxJRT)

**SolarPunk Electric Scooter Private Beach Experience** is the first a la carte regenerative tourism experience that can be purchased with crypto and takes visitors on an unforgettable journey along Tulum's Mayan Jaguar Road, with a stop at the breathtaking archeological ruins while engaging in regenerative practices and ending at a private beach for self regeneration and ocean healing.
[![sandrascootersolarpunk.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Vkyx64L2/sandrascootersolarpunk.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/fJK2qcdv)

## Community Engagement

-**ReFi Web3 Women** gatherings take place once a month at the NFT Boutique. These gatherings cover and educate on topics such as What is ReFi, quadratic funding, and DAOs. The aim is to inform and empower women to join the ReFi movement and share their insights with their communities.
[![2.png](https://i.postimg.cc/zGf93z2X/2.png)](https://postimg.cc/Vd37V8c3)
[![web3women.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/4dBK4m6F/web3women.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/gXLcNcBv)
- Development of art and functional works with children made from plastic, as well as artworks turned into NFTs.
- Collaborate with indigenous leaders and businesses to develop web3 educational programs that resonate with the community.
- Creation of workshops and training sessions for children’s web3 education and parent onboarding in parallel to helping children.
[![ashanti.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/6pH7r72V/ashanti.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/HrysHktj)

## Use of Funds
The allocation of funds will play a pivotal role in advancing our mission. Specifically, a substantial portion of the funds raised will be directed towards the acquisition of the TF100 machine, a cutting-edge technology that holds the key to transforming plastic waste into valuable resources. This crucial step will mark the initiation of our blue circular economy, where repurposed plastic will be utilized in the creation of functional and sustainable products. By investing in the TF100 machine, we are laying the foundation for a self-sustaining ecosystem that not only combats plastic pollution but also generates revenue to fuel our regenerative initiatives.

To supplement these costs, we are embracing the innovative power of NFTs  Through strategic NFT offerings, we aim to not only raise additional funds but also engage our community in a unique and rewarding way. NFTs will serve as more than just digital assets; they will be a symbol of collective action, allowing supporters to have a tangible stake in our circular economy journey and allow holders to take part in sales from the new economy outputs. This fusion of cutting-edge technology and community engagement will drive the financial sustainability of our initiatives and amplify their impact. Your support will directly contribute to jumpstarting this transformative cycle of environmental restoration and economic empowerment, made possible through Gitcoin Grant quadratic funding.

ReFi Tulum stands as a potent catalyst for transformative change, not only in Mexico but across the globe. Rooted in the pillars of circular economies and regenerative tourism, our mission is a resounding call to action, forging a path towards a sustainable and equitable future for generations to come. A vision fueled by innovation, community empowerment, women's agency, and impactful storytelling ignites what we proudly term the "Regenaissance."

project.title: ReFi Knowledge Graph 2.0— A New Digital Brain for the Regenerative Economy
project.description:
In our interconnected world, tackling pressing global challenges demands not just collective knowledge but also the wisdom to decipher complex systems. Enter the revamped ReFi Knowledge Graph. Presently a nexus of 700+ ReFi organizations, 900 key figures, and over 150 events explorable at [refidao.com/ecosystem](https://www.refidao.com/ecosystem), we're now ready to elevate its potential.

The next step forward? Integrating it seamlessly with **[Catalist.Network](https://www.catalist.network/)**. This integration promises unparalleled functionality: envision a vast web of intricate connections, relationships, and insights. And most importantly, ReFi DAO Local Nodes and associated entities will now be able to curate their own bespoke knowledge graphs on a local Airtable instance, ensuring complete control & ownership, while a two-way sync feature will allow data to seamlessly flow back and forth from local to global…

The horizon is clear - our ambition is to spearhead the creation of a powerful insight engine for the ReFi ecosystem and the expansive regenerative economy. For local ReFi nodes, this paves the path for unparalleled localized maps detailing the complete local regenerative economy. Think enriched connections, strategic relationship building, and acute localized intelligence.

Join us in crafting the global digital foundation for the regenerative economy. A future where our envisioned 'classpass for regeneration' becomes a reality, allowing any community to launch and engage with their local regenerative societies, interconnecting people, projects, and businesses in real-time. Let's revolutionize how we see, interact, and grow with the world around us.

### **What do we aim to unlock?**

- **Increased Functionality**: By rebuilding the database architecture and connecting with Catalyst.Network, we aim to establish the ability to map intricate contextual relationships within the ReFi ecosystem.
- **Empower Local Nodes**: Organizations, including ReFi DAO Local Nodes, will easily be able to build their own localised knowledge graph on Airtable, while a seamless 2-way sync can ensure data synchronicity across local and global nodes. Furthermore, with localized ownership, each local node will easily be able to spin up its own data-enriched website, see [ReFiLisboa.com Web App](https://ling478.softr.app/) as an early example!
- **ClassPass for Regeneration**: Using this new infrastructure, we envision a world where making a positive impact is both accessible and rewarding. A world where, no matter where you are, the local regenerative economy is at your fingertips.

### **Why Catalist.Network?**

Today’s tech often misses the mark in fostering real collaboration and intelligence sharing. Catalist.Network confronts this paradox by:

- **Redirecting Focus**: Amidst the digital cacophony, Catalist prioritizes genuine signals over noise, ensuring purpose trumps distraction.
- **Eliminating Redundancies**: By promoting collaboration over competition, it ensures efforts are synergized, not duplicated.

Envision the social pulse of Reddit entwined with Wikipedia’s knowledge-sharing ethos. Catalist.Network emerges as:

- **A Collaboration Haven**: Effortlessly catalogue shared knowledge, resources, and opportunities.
- **The Ultimate Sharehouse**: Extend knowledge boundaries, letting insights traverse community confines.
- **User-Friendly Data Mastery**: Manage intricately linked data systems in a user-friendly interface.

### **The Impact**

1. **Ecosystem Mapping**: Understand who's who, what's where, and how everything interconnects - from people and projects to media and events.
2. **Knowledge Dissemination**: Advanced search and recommendation systems to connect individuals with relevant information and insights.
3. **Relationship Building**: Cultivating connections between individuals, groups, and resources.

### **Join Us**

We're embarking on a transformative journey to revolutionize the way we perceive, connect, and act within the regenerative economy. Support our cause, and together, let's build the global digital brains for the regenerative future.

[![Re-Fi-DAO-Regenerate-the-entire-economy.png](https://i.postimg.cc/1t7W1gnw/Re-Fi-DAO-Regenerate-the-entire-economy.png)](https://postimg.cc/47tvzx1x)

project.title: ReFi Lagos
project.description:
Our project aims to revolutionize climate education and sustainable farming practices within rural farm communities in Nigeria, by harnessing the power of Web3 technology. As these communities face increasing challenges posed by climate change, we recognize the pressing need to empower local farmers with knowledge, tools, and resources to adapt and thrive in a changing environment.

Through strategic collaboration and Web3 events, we will create a dynamic ecosystem that connects indigenous knowledge with cutting-edge climate science, fostering a resilient and informed farming community. Key components of our initiative and impacts include:

Localized Learning: Our platform will offer context-specific content, integrating indigenous knowledge and traditional practices with the latest advancements in climate science, tailored to the unique challenges faced by smallholder farmers in Nigeria.

Interactive Workshops: Virtual workshops and simulations will provide farmers with hands-on experience in implementing sustainable farming techniques, encouraging experimentation and innovation.

Peer Collaboration: Decentralized discussion forums will facilitate collaboration among farmers, enabling the sharing of experiences, best practices, and local insights.

Blockchain-Backed Rewards: Farmers actively engaged in learning and implementing sustainable practices will be rewarded with blockchain-based tokens, incentivizing active participation and knowledge sharing.

By merging Web3 technology with climate education, our project envisions a future where rural farm communities in Lagos achieve climate resilience, food security, and economic prosperity. By empowering local farmers with knowledge and tools, we aspire to create a sustainable and vibrant agricultural sector that not only adapts to climate change but also leads the way in sustainable practices for the region.

project.title: ReFi Toronto - Pioneering Regenerative Finance in Canada's Urban Hub
project.description:
Join us at ReFi Toronto, the forefront of Regenerative Finance in Toronto. Our mission revolves around three core pillars: Edutainment, Engagement, and Empowerment. With your support, we aim to foster a sustainable and inclusive financial ecosystem in Toronto, leveraging the power of Web3 and community collaboration.

![enter image description here](https://svphoto.ca/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Toronto-Cityscape.jpg)  

**Our Vision for Toronto:**

Toronto, a city deeply committed to sustainability, faces challenges like the urban heat island effect, extreme weather events, and rising lake levels. Through ReFi Toronto, we envision a city where these challenges are met with strong hyperlocal community bonds, collaboration between projects and initiatives from different sectors and industries, and an emphasis on making regeneration fun for everyone involved.

![enter image description here](https://www.toronto.ca/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/95b2-ravines-natural-parkland-banner.jpg)

3. **Empowerment**: Acting as a catalyst for entrepreneurial growth & development in the ReFi sector in Toronto.

![enter image description here](https://www.utoronto.ca/sites/default/files/ward%20island%20garbage3.jpg)  

**Budgeting and Funding:**

Our goal is to raise $6,000 to support our initiatives. The funds will be allocated towards:

We've already hosted 4 events with a total attendance of over 150 people:

4. Introduction to Crypto Philanthropy, featuring MetaFundWe
 ![enter image description here](https://harthouse.ca/assets/images/uploads/blogs/farmstory_hero.jpg)

1. **Tian-Yuan Zhao**: Cofounder, with a background in web3 design and a passion for circular economics.

4. **Yair Garcia**: Cofounder of @antisat_eth @criptecmx, passionate about sustainable transportation and repurposing.

5. **Shayan Eskandari**: Founding Member, with deep connections in the web3 space.

6. **Vanessa Prevost**: Passionate about AI ethics and governance, and the founder of The Bennu Foundation.

![enter image description here](https://media.timeout.com/images/105283089/image.jpg)

**Join Us in Our Mission:**

We invite you to be a part of our journey in revolutionizing the Regenerative Finance space in Toronto. Your support and donations will play a pivotal role in achieving our vision for a sustainable and inclusive financial ecosystem in the city.
