project.title: ReFi Denver
project.description:
**Summary of the Grant:**

Support the ReFi Denver project, a Colorado-based initiative focused on community engagement, local regeneration, and personal transformation. Through curated events, workshops, and partnerships, we empower individuals to create sustainable change. Help us address environmental challenges, nurture collective well-being, and build a resilient community.

**Introduction to the Project:**

Envision a world where the majestic Rocky Mountains cradle a land of boundless possibility. Picture crisp alpine air intertwining with whispers of evergreen forests, as crystal-clear rivers weave stories of serenity. In this haven, a harmonious rhythm pulses through the heart of Colorado, a rhythm that echoes with the promise of a better, more conscious, and healthier planet. Now, imagine being part of a community that embraces these ideals, where the ancient wisdom of nature converges with cutting-edge technology. A community that gathers under the open sky to share knowledge, to share in humanity and togetherness, create regenerative solutions, and cultivate transformation within and without. Join us in ReFi Denver, as we bridge the gap between aspirations and actions, embarking on a journey of co-creation, unity, and hope, to shape a world that mirrors the beauty of our dreams.

ReFi Denver is a dynamic initiative in Colorado, dedicated to fostering community engagement, local regeneration, and transformative inner work. Our project focuses on creating a platform for individuals to learn, collaborate, and take action for positive change in their local area.

**Problem and Solution:**

Denver and the Front Range of Colorado face challenges such as deteriorating air quality and water scarcity due to population density and wildfires. ReFi Denver addresses these issues through engaging events, workshops, and projects that empower communities to have improved awareness of local climate issues, contribute to regenerative efforts, and enhance overall well-being.

**Goal of the Project:**

Our goal is to create a regenerative and resilient future for Colorado. By offering diverse community events, workshops, regenerative projects, and partnerships, we aim to equip individuals with the tools and knowledge needed to make sustainable changes in their communities and within themselves. We strive to foster a vibrant and interconnected network committed to ecological restoration and personal growth.

**The Team:**

Our team brings together diverse expertise to lead ReFi Denver:

- **Nikki:** Accomplished Chief of Staff with a background in communications, design, and digital marketing. Passionate about mission-aligned work and community-building.
- **Erik:** Experienced in engineering and the oil and gas industry. CTO of CarbonPath, skilled in problem-solving and multidisciplinary collaboration.
- **Kyle:** Background in engineering and a strong work history in oil and gas. Valuable experience in project management and problem-solving.

**Budgeting:**

Funds raised will support the following areas:

- Event organization and promotion
- Workshop materials and resources
- Regenerative projects (tree planting, cleanup initiatives, etc)
- Community engagement initiatives
- Administrative and operational costs
- Partner collaborations

**Call to Action - Donate to ReFi Denver:**

We invite you to support ReFi Denver's vision of creating a regenerative and resilient future for our community. Your contribution will help fund workshops, projects, and partnerships that empower the community to address environmental challenges and promote well-being. Join us in building a vibrant and interconnected network dedicated to positive change.

Thank you for considering our grant proposal. Together, we can make a lasting impact on Denver's environment and collective consciousness.

project.title: Inferer
project.description:
![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/52435a954d3139813a4cd4069696f482/Frame_41.png)

# What's Inferer?

Inferer is a user identity analysis service on blockchain. We try to build a label-rich user portrait system, which is based on on-chain and off-chain data analysis and data mining, infer user identity through algorithms models and offers the final user identify evaluation service.

# Why we build Inferer?

1. We're still in a early stage of crypto development, and user environment is under chaos in some way. There're so many bots around which hurts user experience, so    many security accidents occurred in these days which stopped more users from getting engaged with crypto. Hence, we hope we could build a service which identifies the users through the behaviors behind the address. We would need to use the benefits from the immutable data on chain and do lots of data analysis and data mining to achieve that goal. On the other hand, we would also like to offer great products which facilitate end users to have a much more convenient way to check the identity of the account address. In this way, we hope it could increase the cost of bot activities and raise the bar when they try to hurt others, which we hope would improve the user environment ultimately.

2. The data infra system and user label system we built in the above process could also help serve in SocialFi projects and Risk Control in fund transfer on chain.

# What's our vision?

We believe the value of data analysis and data mining would grow very quickly when data on chain explodes. And Inferer would like to start from users' perspective and build more great products to form a web3 user identity platform, which we hope could help contribute to great user ecosystem on chain.

# What we're currently building?

We're currently focused on building a user identity analysis product, which hope to facilitate crypto users to have a convenient user identity check and reduce the bot activities. This'll start from a nice tool for crypto users to improve their efficiency at the beginning. We hope we could help contribute to great user ecosystem on chain in the end.

![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/daa44d9a3796d1bd8da62885e95c407b/intro.png)

We believe COMMUNITY matters a lot in Inferer. And we're trying to build our community which Inferer belongs to. Anyone who's interested is greatly welcome.

# Update

2023/7/29:

1: We're excited to announce that Inferer officially supports Inferer Ranking on website https://ranking.inferer.xyz. It offers great product quality with concise on-chain data analysis! Brand new product user experience, new design interface, more advanced data analysis, we're offering a high level product and we're pretty proud of it. Again, we're committed to keep improving Inferer Ranking and believe it would bring huge impact in crypto project analysis.

2: We have another great product Inferer Identity is on the way to get online as well (expected late Aug early Sep). That's also amazing! If would introduce a great scoring system for crypto users and provide great values for projects to check their target users avatars. Please give us a little bit time to build it to a great quality and we have confidence that it would surprise you.

3: Recently we're discussing a lot on future airdrop product and have a great finding on this. We're having a demo to verify the concept. We do believe it would be a thing to crypto community.

![](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F2WVefob0AAHIFS?format=jpg&name=large)

2023/4/7:

1: For Inferer community gitcoin members, we're back! Back here to report our progress regularly, and brings with an amazing new product - Inferer Ranking.

2: We're excited to announce that Inferer could not only support the on-chain user address identity analysis, but also for on-chain contract web3 projects (especially NFT project). This would be obviously a tremendous scope improvement for Inferer. We hope not only we could provide users efficient identity look up tool (compared with checking transactions in etherscan or polygonscan), but also we could provide a brand new & efficient way helping users checking projects(especially NFT) users' group portraits, which could be a great reference for new users to check whether a project is with good quality or just a scam project to rug pull. We believe some new crypto users would need this and we treat this in a very valuable way!

3: We love Reddit! Not only their avatar nft users grow exponentially from 3m to 10m, but also for the unbelievably great crypto-friendly culture. We enjoy quite a lot in having discussions in Reddit. And it helped us to determine our first project analysis landing on Reddit Avatar Collections. It's quite valuable for us to analyze all avartar through, which gives us a very clear concept that which avartar series is now trending and which nft now leads in profits. We believe this would be quite useful for those reddit avatar traded users. In the long run, we're going to cover many more projects and willing to bring great values for crypto users. We believe this would definetly bring great values to crypto and help contribute to great user ecosystem on chain.

![](https://d31ygswzsyecnt.cloudfront.net/docs/af7660b3640f3eda4fdbda801bc733e7/Frame_1321314535.png)

2023/02/16:

1: We're excited to announce officially that Inferer now has a brand new official site https://www.inferer.xyz. It brings totally new design language and much better user experience. This new version shows great product level in Inferer. We believe that you all would love it.


2: We brought a great internal engineering product here: Inferer label backend system. In order to reach unbelievably lots of labels, we need to improve our label processing efficiency, in a massive improvement way. In detail, it needs to handle label creation, label deletion, label edit, label check, label daily update, label comparison, label degrees and many more label related operations, all in a user friendly way with great efficiency. This leads to our new coming amazing product: Inferer label backend system, which aimed to cover these requirements and take overall label processing efficiency to a much higher level. Inferer label system has come to v1.0 and been put into use NOW. It would also iterate very quickly. We're very passionate to polish this tool to help Inferer reach to next stage.


3: We're excited to announce that AWS has decided to help fund in Inferer! We had amazing conversations and had a very great consensus: Inferer is a great project and would like to see the achievements that Inferer would take in the future. That would be a very interesting thing that we both believed.

![](https://d31ygswzsyecnt.cloudfront.net/docs/e9eba657ae1339a539a38cc6040c0b15/%E6%88%AA%E5%B1%8F2023-01-31_%E4%B8%8B%E5%8D%884.11.36.png)

2022/11/28:


1. We're excited to announce that Inferer Search has been renamed to Inferer Identity.


2. Inferer Identity has updated to v0.0.13. In this version, we included a major new feature: Inferer Label, which would be the key to our future user identity analysis service. Inferer Label would serve directly into our user portrait system and become the data basis in our evaluation algorithms. We would increase lots of labels to help us reach the precise analysis result.


3. For Inferer Label, not only we're adding more & more labels, we also try to dig more interesting dimensions on labels. We add 'degree' metric to Inferer Label, such as "Big Ens User", which refers to users who adopted more than 5 Ens names on their account or "Ens Collector", which refers to users who adopted more than 30 Ens names on their account, this extend info would help a lot in figuring out user's motive or interest. We're excited to see the benefit this brings to our evaluation process.


4. On engineering, we want to reach the point that Inferer Internal System could label new qualified users day by day, automatically. And we have covered this NOW.


![](https://d31ygswzsyecnt.cloudfront.net/docs/b5d062a0df2ffc2553710c2fd10c90f5/Frame_45.png)


2022/10/22:

-   Inferer Search has updated to v0.0.10. We put quite much time on many details which we believe would improve users' experience in a long time. Some of them listed:


    1. always focus on the address edit text which could help users to replace new address, and avoid delete address one by one


    2. fix that some users can't launch "Inferer Search" through mouse' right click "Inferer 0x*****" after they sleep the computer


    3. add more twitter KOLs in Recommend feature, which facilitate users' check on these KOLs' identity


    4. add more hackers info in Warning feature, which we hope could help keep users from scams


    5. integrate internal server APIs to optimize the JSON API response time


    6. add support for users to switch their binding address to inferer account


2022/09/28:


We officially launched our Inferer Search product in chrome store now. Check it out https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/inferer/cihpoafnmmlancocngfdmdcfhkfjglnj. DM us anything on Twitter(https://twitter.com/inferer_xyz). And join us if u're interested, let's build it better!

![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/c8ceb97d0bad680107fd0a023c2de702/c2.png)

project.title: ReFI Pinda
project.description:
Proposal: ReFi Local Node - Pindamonhangaba

Our ReFi Local Node project in Pindamonhangaba seeks to bridge the gap between sustainable practices, holistic well-being, and the emerging world of Web3 technologies. Through a series of engaging and diverse events, both in-person and online, we aim to reconnect individuals with nature, foster community collaboration, and provide educational content in Portuguese about Web3 and decentralized finance. Our initiative will include curated photography exhibitions, immersive agroforestry experiences, and online onboarding sessions. By combining art, nature, and technology, we strive to inspire regenerative action in our local community while supporting the global movement towards a more sustainable future.

1.	Introduction to the Project: The ReFi Local Node project in Pindamonhangaba is dedicated to fostering a sense of interconnectedness between nature, sustainable living, and the Web3 movement. Our vision is to create an inclusive space where individuals can engage with both the physical environment and the virtual world, ultimately contributing to a more regenerative and harmonious future.

2.	Problem and Solution: Nurturing a connection with nature and harnessing the untapped potential of Web3 technologies for advancing sustainable practices remains a challenge in our community. Through a series of engaging events, we intend to bridge this gap. By combining hands-on experiences with digital platforms, we aim to create a holistic understanding of how technology and nature can coexist to address real-world challenges.

3.	Project Goals: Our primary goal is to reconnect people with nature and empower them with knowledge about sustainable practices and emerging technologies. We envision building a community that actively participates in reforestation initiatives, agroforestry workshops, and Web3 education. By fostering this synergy, we aspire to promote positive changes in individual behaviors, communal relationships, and environmental awareness.

4.	Team Presentation: Our team consists of passionate individuals deeply committed to sustainable living and technology. Jorge, Deroila, and Cauê bring diverse expertise in sustainability, community engagement, and tech education. We are further supported by partnerships with NFTreesBrasil and Diogo from @agroforestDAO, enriching our efforts with their valuable insights and experiences.

5.	Impact Measurement: We believe in quantifying our impact through tangible metrics. Attendee participation, post-event surveys, and engagement rates on social media platforms will help us gauge the success of our initiatives. Additionally, we will collect narratives of changed behaviors and testimonies from participants, reflecting the positive influence our events have on their daily lives.

We're committed to transparently measuring our impact and sharing our progress. In addition to traditional methods, we're exploring innovative ways to showcase event outcomes, including the possibility of using Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs) to represent tangible evidence of positive changes. These NFTs could capture transformed spaces, participant testimonials, and online collaborations, providing a more engaging way for the community to see the results of their involvement. This aligns with Web3 principles and enhances our mission of promoting sustainability and Web3 awareness. The NFT concept is in exploration, and your support will help us refine this approach, adding a unique layer of engagement and accountability.
How You Can Make a Difference:
By contributing to the ReFi Local Node - Pindamonhangaba, you are directly supporting:

• Experiential Activities (Palestras, workshops, and field-based activities): Join us in hosting thought-provoking discussions, skill-building workshops, and hands-on field activities that bring sustainable practices to life. Your contribution helps cover venue rentals, educational materials, and refreshments, ensuring each event is impactful and accessible. (Estimated: $1,367.35 / R$6,700)

• Outreach and Awareness: Help us spread the word and raise awareness about regenerative practices, sustainability, and the power of community engagement. Your support will fuel our online campaigns, social media outreach, and community-building efforts. (Estimated: $1,795.92 / R$8,800)

• Expert Facilitators: Empower our workshops and activities by enabling us to bring in specialized professionals in sustainability, environmental expertise, and local knowledge. Your contribution helps cover their fees and ensures top-notch engagement. (Estimated: $834.25 / R$4,072.72)

• Essential Logistics: Support the backbone of our initiative by providing the resources needed for smooth operations, including materials, equipment, administrative necessities, and more. Your contribution ensures our events are well-organized and impactful.

(Estimated: $1,122.45 / R$5,500)
Total Project Funding Goal: $5,119 (Approx. R$25,072.72)

Join us in catalyzing positive change and co-creating a regenerative future for Pindamonhangaba and beyond. Your support matters. Together, we can transform communities and make a lasting impact on the planet.

Let's Regenerate, Together!

project.title: refi node ile-ife Nigeria
project.description:
Refi Node Ileife is a community-driven initiative that aims to address some of the environmental challenges facing the Ileife community. The initiative's four key areas of focus are:
Crop diversity regeneration: Refi Node Ileife seeks to support the regeneration of crop diversity in the community by promoting the cultivation of traditional and heirloom varieties of crops. This will help to improve food security and resilience to climate change.
Carbon footprint reduction: Refi Node Ileife will work to reduce the community's carbon footprint by promoting sustainable practices such as energy efficiency, waste reduction, and tree planting.
Historical arts and artefact preservation: Refi Node Ileife will work to preserve the community's historical arts and artefacts. This will help to ensure that the community's cultural heritage is passed on to future generations.
Waste and plastic recycling: Refi Node Ileife will work to reduce waste and plastic pollution in the community. This will be done through education, awareness-raising, and the provision of recycling facilities.
Refi Node Ileife is a valuable initiative that is making a positive impact on the environment and the community. The initiative is a model for other communities that are looking to address environmental challenges.

project.title: ReFi Barcelona
project.description:
ReFi ja és aquí! 🌱

ReFi Barcelona is a ReFi local node, building bridges between the ReFi and the local ecosystems, propelling the development of the ReFi movement in Barcelona.

We want to design engaging ways to learn from diversity and build communities of collaboration based on a shared understanding of the vast opportunities that lie in the transition towards regenerative cultures. Creating regenerative systems is not simply a technical, economic, ecological or social shift: it has to go hand-in-hand with an underlying shift in the way we think about ourselves, **our relationships with each other and with life as a whole.**

ReFi Barcelona idea is to be aligned with Commons principles by promoting shared ownership, community engagement, and decentralized decision-making for sustainable resource management.

## Barcelona 🌞

Barcelona is the biggest (entirely) European city in the Mediterranean sea. The city, and Catalonia in general, has a rich history and actuality of support to progressive initiatives. 

Barcelona, as a densely populated urban center, faces a unique set of challenges stemming from its status as a bustling metropolis and the impacts of over-tourism. The city's social fabric has undergone transformations due to increased tourism, which has at times strained local resources and community cohesion. Furthermore, the depletion of natural resources, coupled with recurrent droughts exacerbated by rising temperatures due to climate change, has compounded these issues.

There is a growing web3 ecosystem in the area with deep roots in the history of web3.

### Appetite for Regeneration 🧑‍🌾

Public institutions such as the Ajuntament de Barcelona (city council) has had a big focus on positive social & ecological change, with active initiatives addressing urban regeneration, waste management and climate change - being reference in many of these. Government and institutional support for sustainability projects is notable, creating a conducive environment for local initiatives. The city is known for its innovative character and is home to numerous entrepreneurial ventures and investment activities that can be aligned with regenerative principles.

## ReFi Barcelona Gènesis 🌱

![ReFi_BCN_Kickoff](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/F1z0YbgWIAETCCQ?format=jpg&name=900x900)

On the 20th of July ReFi Barcelona had its Kick-Off event bringing together an initial group of people interested in supporting the strengthening of regeneration and ReFi in Barcelona.

Check out some more about the event here: https://twitter.com/ReFiBarcelona/status/1683490586018422795


**The local node can offer a range of goods and services, including:**

- Regenerative events, workshops, and networking opportunities.
- Sustainable project incubation and support.
- Community engagement and citizens' assemblies for shared decision-making.
- Partnerships with local businesses for collaborative initiatives.
- Funding opportunities through grants, web3 native fundraising, and partnerships to projects.


**ReFi Barcelona plans to secure funding and revenue through various channels, including:**

- Grants from programs like Gitcoin and CLR.fund.
- Community events, memberships, and sponsorships.
- Ecosystem grants, such as for Celo's and Optimism's.
- Collaboration with local initiatives and government support.
- Exploration of other web3 fundraising mechanisms.
- Capitalization and tokenization of positive action.

## Team details 🌟

ReFi BCN founding team:

- [Luiz Fernando Gomez Segala](https://twitter.com/louizfe)
- [Justina Svitaite](https://twitter.com/jcukini)
- [Emanuel Toledo](https://twitter.com/emanuel_tol)
- [Roger Pan](https://twitter.com/rog3rpan)
- [Emilia Sierra Guzmán](https://twitter.com/MowgliRegen)

project.title: ReFi Saravena
project.description:
ReFiDAO Saravena is a community located in Saravena, a city in Arauca, Colombia, where conflict and guerrilla activities have impacted the region, in addition to the presence of oil companies in the area.

From the municipal government's side, there are few environmentally impactful proposals. General awareness campaigns have emerged aimed at the population, but with limited impact.

We've taken on the challenge of initiating our ReFi community with the idea of making an impact on our region.

Here's what we aim to achieve:

1) Identification of habitats or locations for tree planting.
2) Trash collection drive.
3) Engaging with foundations or tourism companies to guide tourists off the traditional tourist path, introducing an alternative tourism plan that allows exploration of different positive aspects of Saravena municipality, such as its rivers, farms (banana, cacao, orange, yucca, etc. cultivation).
4) Establishing an environmental awareness program in schools, taking students to events focused on cleaning specific areas for tree planting, aiding in river conservation, and creating gardens within educational institutions.
5) Promoting a shift in the environmental care culture of the Saravena population, starting with the promotion of biodegradable or reusable bags.
6) Advocating for respect towards indigenous communities and contributing to the preservation of their cultures.

project.title: Hamar Social Labs | Refi Raipur
project.description:
We create systems, that bring life to people and people to life.

We work to create a world where the economy, society, and environment are not in conflict, but rather work in tandem to create  a better future for all.

Hamar Social Labs (HSL) is a unique social enterprise that aims to foster innovation and regeneration underserved communities. Our goal is to create and support social impact projects that promote regeneration, innovation and tech in local communities. 

We offer high quality, design and technology support to the communities, nonprofits and individuals. 

'Hamar' translates to 'Our' in many local Indian languages, which represents our vision to serve the communities which has been traditionally marginalized. 

We are a young and diverse team from Central India, also a co-believer of technology and internet as an enabling tool. 

We are also building a community of rural-tribal women entrepreneurs and 1st generation learners to facilitate fundraising, entrepreneurial support and scholarships to learn technology, design and social development. 

Our current projects include: 

1. Mohri : https://www.mohri.in/

Mohri is an initiative to retain the diversity of our ancestral culture by illustrating myths, legends & folklore of a tribe as inferred by the local artists through their art. We believe that they should get a chance to make a respectable living out of their craft. We are furnishing them with a market for their craft where everyone across the globe gets to savour these folklores.

2. Gaon Wali : https://www.gaonwali.in/

Around 2200+ rural and tribal women came together & formed a company. The project model is to purchase fresh & pure raw material from farmers of Chhattisgarh. Processed & packaged in the manufacturing unit set up by the company formed by these 2200+ women. This value added & finished product is being sold in the market at competitive prices. 

Gaon Wali aims to provide the better cost of raw material to the farmers. These extra money usually go the big industrialists. Gaon Wali aims to cut off those mediators & bring the money to the local farmers.

Also, we want to present a pure, rich-quality and fresh products to the common people of India.


2. Chhapaak : https://www.chhapaak.com/

Art school in the city of Raipur. Now a registered nonprofit. 

A platform for those who have a potential to become an Artist and see themselves becoming a world class skilled artist, both passionate and hardworking.

project.title: ReFi Cape Town
project.description:
Younglings, ixo and RLabs have formed a ReFi Local Node in Cape Town to nurture community conversations around the tokenised impacts economy. Our aim is to empower young South Africans to support initiatives that address Cape Town’s most pressing challenges. The core challenges we address are socioeconomic inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to essential resource flows such as energy, water, sanitation, housing and education.
Kindly donate to our grant so we can start our journey of youth-led education for regeneration! With a match funding pool of over $25k thanks to the amazing GitCoin community, Celo and Celo Europe, every single dollar makes a big difference!
We intend to raise: 4000USD that will be consciously spent to achieve exponential outcomes:

1. Host monthly community events: These will include expert guest speakers in ReFi, Web3 and urban challenges in African cities. We hope to engage young people from from RLabs, Younglings, and YOMA. We also hope to engage the City of Cape Town, Western Cape Government, Department of Basic Education, Stellenbosch University Centre for Sustainability Transitions, University of Cape Town, African Centre for Cities, ICLEI Africa, UNICEF, and private sector organisations interested in Web3 and sustainability.
2. Host biannual hackathons: Focus on upskilling young local software developers. Problem statements encourage hackers to build user-friendly and mobile first dApps that address contextual challenges. Collaborate with other platforms who can provide technical support and infrastructure. 

3. Host a digital Impacts Marketplace: To use the ixo software stack to develop and host a ReFi Cape Town Impacts Marketplace. The objective of this is to support high-impact social projects in developing digital assets for impact measurement, verification and fundraising.

project.title: Porto web3 Club
project.description:
We propose a comprehensive project that integrates tradition, emotion, and technology to foster a vibrant and connected community in Porto, Portugal. Through a multifaceted approach involving events, applications, protocols, and a web3-focused community, we aim to address burnout, nurture creativity, and unite local individuals with the principles of ReFi


In a world enamoured by technological advancement, it is crucial not to overlook the fragility of the human experience. Our project seeks to strike a harmonious balance between technological innovation and human connection. By nurturing inclusivity, collaboration, and cultural heritage, we aspire to build an empowered and united community.

The unchecked pace of technological evolution often neglects the intricate facets of human existence. The lack of space for empathy and understanding in technological advancements can lead to detachment, burnout, and societal estrangement. Within the heart of Porto, a city rich in history and resilience, the challenges of gentrification, economic disparity, and cultural erosion threaten to erode the city's unique identity. Our project endeavours to tackle these issues head-on by uniting and harvesting the individuals and causes that are already busy with these problems 

Our project revolves around an indirect strategy that encompasses somatic practices, immersive events, networking initiatives, and collaborative endeavours, all rooted in the principles of  community, locality and social impact technology. By doing so, we aim to forge a community of locals and web3 enthusiasts,  that employ ( or learn to employ) technology as a conduit for enriching human lives and resolving pressing societal dilemmas.

Our Goals:
Enhance Well-being: Introduce comprehensive somatic and therapeutic movement programs to combat burnout, stress, and mental fatigue, fostering a robust sense of physical and emotional well-being among community members.

Catalyze Collaboration: Orchestrating an array of events, workshops, and hackathons that amalgamate local talents, artisans, grassroots leaders, and pioneering web3 enterprises, thereby facilitating meaningful interactions, ideation, and groundbreaking problem-solving.

Empower Microcosmic Communities: By offering infrastructure, resources, and networking platforms, we intend to galvanize artists, artisans, and community managers, enabling them to thrive, contribute, and catalyze local advancement.

Counter Gentrification: In a proactive response to gentrification, our efforts will centre on nurturing local culture, amplifying distinctive talents, and  creating tools that help communities to fight against evictions 


Comprising a dynamic cohort with diverse backgrounds spanning art, community management, production, and technological innovation, our team  is also all Porto Native. Our track record encompasses grassroots initiatives and state-funded projects, all underpinning our unyielding commitment to empowering Porto's thriving community.

Efficient resource allocation is pivotal to actualize our visionary objectives. The budget breakdown will encompass:
Venue procurement and equipment provisioning for events, workshops, and movement classes
Engagement of distinguished guest speakers, trainers, and mentors for hackathons and networking sessions
Web3 development and aesthetic refinement of apps and protocols
Strategic marketing and outreach initiatives to seamlessly integrate the community
Administrative and operational overhead
The establishment of an avant-garde co-working space tailored to accommodate nomadic entities

Elevate this transformative project by contributing to its realisation. Your participation will serve as a foundational pillar for cultivating a resilient community, kindling cross-disciplinary collaboration, and fortifying Porto's distinctive cultural narrative. Together, we can co-create a future wherein technology converges harmoniously with humanity.

project.title: ReFiMiami
project.description:
ReFi Miami is building a public, private and third-sector coalition to realize the vision of a Regenerative Miami by 2050.

Sparked by the community behind SustainaCities and Silvi, Logos Capital and the Miami Government Blockchain Association, the #SaveMiami campaign believes that regenerative finance (“ReFi”) can help #SaveMiami. ReFi Miami is a convergence of thought leaders across technology, science, finance, government, wellness, art, music and education. Our vision is to bring together the right people, tools and capital to help Miami overcome the myriad of challenges facing our wonderful city: climate change, social injustice, biodiversity collapse, AI-risk and more…

We are pioneering the global regenerative movement in Miami as a model for coastal cities around the world. Many years of preparation has been getting us ready for this moment.
The moment is now!

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BkxO2tVn3.jpg)

**Earth Day Kickoff**

We kicked off ReFi Miami at Earth Day Climate Collabothon this past April 22 via #SaveMiami organized by Logos Blue Foundation, Sustainacities and partners to start gathering community and bringing awareness to the Global Stocktake and the obstacles and opportunities that exist to regenerate our natural capital assets.

We continued hard at work hacking solutions through the week culminating out best ideas and celebrating with your first ceremonial tree planting party!

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bkj1AsN3n.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJjy0jNh3.jpg)


![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy84hKVh3.jpg)



![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/r1gCrK42h.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkHRStNh2.jpg)








**The Challenges**


As recently as last week flooding in Miami Dade County has brought to all of our attention: Climate and environmental change and its complex web of crisis is real. It is not a distant future. It is facing us now and especially palpable in Miami

* Miami's watershed is being destroyed 💧
* Biscayne Bay is dying ❌
* High temperatures are going up at an alarming rate 🥵
* Farming is destroying land & polluting waters ☠️
* Septic tanks and leaking water lines are polluting our waters
* Real estate developers are encroaching on urban development boundaries 

We are now forced to monitor water, air quality & heat data in order to make sense of the rising toxicity and its impact on our environment and our residents. 🤢

**Our time is running out** ⌛️
With one of the highest property prices in the United States (and in the world), we have a significant cost to inaction, and inadequate action for the climate crisis that is at han

**Major Opportunities**


The time is ripe for a regenerative village at the heart of the city of Miami. We are gathering the brightest minds and the most value-aligned capital into the work of regeneration.
Below is just a list of the amazing initiatives between public, private and third-sector institutions emerging in Miami.
* Miami has adopted a 1 million tree commitment
* Miami-Dade County adopted the Climate Change Action Plan (reduce emissions by 80% by 2050).
* Miami-Dade County founded a Resilience Office to focus on climate change adaptation and disaster preparedness.
* Miami has become a hub for web3, with several major companies setting up shop in the area along with the world’s largest Bitcoin conference
* Miami-based Knight Foundation has committed $10 million to climate solutions in the region.
* Harvard Business School Professors created a case study on Miami as an ideal hub for climate solutions that could be exported to the rest of the world.
* Florida International University (FIU) has a Sea Level Solutions Center that focuses on sea-level rise and resiliency.
* FIU has launched an Environmental Finance & Risk Management Program.
* University of Miami (UM)’s Rosenstiel School of Marine and Atmospheric Science research climate change and oceanography.
* NOAA has a presence with the Atlantic Oceanographic and Meteorological Laboratory located on Virginia Key.
* Florida Climate Institute has released “Laying the Groundwork for ‘Getting to Neutral’ in the State of Florida.
* Miami-Dade has the worlds firsts ever Chief Heat Officer
* Miami-Dade County has the first Chief Bay Officer
* Overall, there is a strong interest and growing momentum in the Miami area towards regenerative practices, sustainable and regenerative finance, and the development of web3 ecosystem.

**ReFiMiami founding members:**

**SustainaCities**
Sustainacities is powering the transition towards the. Netzero economy with its Net ZeroToolkit (“NZ0”).

The NZ0 guides cities, enterprises and residents on a profitable path towards NetZero, including smart cities techn with an environmental focused including Blue and Green economy pillars to help Miami achieve its targets, understand its role in the global value chain and model sustainability for other cities around the world.

To guide the multiple stakeholders on their journey, we created Mia, the Climate Genie, our Chief Climate Officer.
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/BJ9b4Y4n3.jpg)


MIA guides users through **“ClimaGo”** — our “Pokémon Go for Climate” game that immerses users in the MiamiVerse and lets them go out into the real world, and play and scan to learn and earn in an eco-adventure to rediscover your city!

Click here to see what the experience is like!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DSC5LWpPIT4
Save Miami ARTREES ZOOM - Powered by Silvi and AR Miami

**MiamiVerse**


Miami-Verse Project with flood scenario simulations:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uf3CLN1-Jgg




**Logos Blue Economy Foundation**

Logos Blue Economy Foundation has organized an OpenCLimate Collabothon innaugurated during 2023 Earth Day, to build local understanding and capacity around Natural Capital Accounting, Nature Based Solutions and economics of Ecosystem Services in an effort to pilot one of the first subnational Blue Bonds in Miami-Dade, complete with Marine Ecosystem Credits like the innovative blue carbon, plastics, eutrophication and biodiversity credits.

You can learn more about these smart blue bonds at www.bluebonds.org

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk8tNYNhh.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S18FNtEn3.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rkPYNYEnh.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bydt4K433.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Sy_F4K43h.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1DtVF423.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B1OYEt4hn.jpg)
source: Marine Ecosystem Credits, Open Earth Foundation

**Silvi Protocol**
www.twitter.com/silviprotocol
Silvi is a reforestation protocol headquartered in Miami. Backed by Celo, Climate Collective, Gitcoin community and Filecoin, Silvi is building financial and coordination tools to help a billion people steward a trillion trees. It has pilots aorund the world including rural Kenya and is now looking to build upon the million tree challenge in Miami via gamified urban forestry experiences in order to grow Miami's tree canopy and tree-dependent lifesupport systems.
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkV1vFVn3.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S1BkwtEn3.jpg)
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SkSJwtN2h.jpg)



**ReFiMiami founders:**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rko7UYVh3.png)

**Silvio Pupo** has worked on more than $1B worth of deals, received financing letters from multilaterals for over $400M, and raised more than $10M for fintech startups. Silvio has over 35 portfolio companies as an angel investor, and invested as a limited partner into venture funds. Silvio was a partner for the Americas and LatAm for the first Global Online Security Token Roadshop (“GOIR”) received over has we scaled venture debt after a contract to rollout rewards services for Banks on the VISA Network in Latin America and the Caribbean. Silvio is the founder of impact investment firm www.logoscapital.io, bluebonds.org, Government Blockchain Association of Florida and Sustainable Smart Cities, sustainacities.com


![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkQHUtE33.png)

**Djimo Serodio** has a background in regenerative agriculture, environmental science and citizen science frameworks. He is the founder of:
Silvi.Earth - A reforestation protocol and core founding member of ReFiMiami looking to bring citizen-led urban forestry to Miami.
JustLearn.io - An Environmental Science EdTech startup serving science to 40k students
www.twitter.com/djimoserodio

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rJ0I8YNhn.png)

**Katrina Morris** has been developing online and helping small to mid-size businesses with their e-commerce sites since 1995. She has recently begun expanding her knowledge base in web3, with an emphasis on ReFi, and completed her first hackathon at ETHDenver, at which her team won a $5000 bounty from DFinity. She has also recently completed a certification course in Sustainable Tourism Destination Management through eCornell. She believes in the potential of web3 for social and ecological good and is onboard to help build healthier ecosystems, for communities and for the environment.

**Founding contributors**

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/ryy4wFN2h.png)
**Paul “Paulsky” Bronstein, Founder, XR Labs**
https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-bronstein-589132a8/
Storyteller/Futurist/Activist who aims to utilize XR and Emergent Technology too build up a personal and unique technical skillset and access to a network of individuals that emphasize the use of Technology and Art to build up creative XR marketing campaigns and immersive storytelling to enhance products and services.


![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/S12q8KV22.png)

**Lloyd Emelle** https://www.linkedin.com/in/gurulloyd

Texan tech genius, transplanted to South Florida. Passionate about life, and transforming communities through government focused technologies for Municipalities. Founded Code for Philly. Lloyd named our Miami Climate Genie, Mia.


![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/SJTv8FV2n.png)

**Greg Taffet** (COO Logos Blue) is currently a mentor and adviser to startup and growth companies. He works with the executive team to provide strategic direction on scalability, digital transformation, technology, and security. He also works with key emerging technologies such as blockchain, and deep learning. He is also actively involved in Coral reef restoration. Greg has produced the CIO track at ITPalooza for 8 years. It is the largest CIO-level invite-only event in South Florida


![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/rk-XwKNh3.jpg)
**Priscilla D'Brito**, Artist

Artists and Founder of Sea Sirens Designs Eco-Design artificial reefs that fosters marine life and coral reproduction through underwater sculptures. We produce high volume artificial reef custom design sculptures for resorts, private islands, commercial and educational projects. We are involved with STEAM education and partners with local marine conservations as well as Universities in South Florida.

Colombiana en Miami, she makes our Magic City move and shake. Web3 recruiter and early organizer of the #SaveMiami efforts, Maria supports at large with administrative, arts and culture.

Eugene Montoya joined Wells Fargo’s Sustainability Group in January of 2020 as the company’s first dedicated climate change strategist at a senior enterprise officer level. Since joining, he’s worked steadfastly on the integration of climate-related risk and climate-related opportunity data into various use cases including TCFD reporting, net-zero sectoral target setting and measurement for financial portfolios and creating the company’s first enterprise-scale technology solution for financed emissions. The coupling of net-zero and resilience resonates with his personal mission of climate finance mobilization aimed at meeting various investment objectives for public and private stakeholders. Such objectives include capital preservation, future cost savings, sustained insurability, revenue stabilization and diversification, and triple bottom-line outcomes that stem from climate resilient investing.

Juan Carlos “JCFractal” Gallo, is the founder of ARMiami, and a founding member of XR Miami, a community of developers and creators from South florida. Our AR murals and experiences, raising awareness for Climate Change, have been featured in the Miami Herald, PBS News-hour, The New Yorker Magazine, NBC6, DecoDrive, NBC10.

project.title: ReFi Guadalajara
project.description:
ReFi Movement in Guadalajara: Bridging Regeneration 

Introduction: We are at the forefront of a transformative movement in #Guadalajara. Our mission is to create a bridge between finances, technology, academia, public policy, and regenerative agriculture and livestock practices. By emphasizing these intersections, we aim to empower Guadalajara's communities to address some of the city's most pressing challenges through workshops, incubation, and investment. These challenges encompass poverty, inequality, youth unemployment, and a general lack of access to essential resources such as energy, water, sanitation, housing, and education.

Project Explanation: Through this initiative, we aim to deepen the understanding of ReFi in Guadalajara, particularly focusing on regenerative agriculture and livestock practices. By doing so, we hope to enhance the environmental and social impact that new ventures can bring to the region. This renewed focus on ReFi projects and understanding will enable us to grow economically without compromising our environment and quality of life. Collaborating closely with ReFiDAO, we aim to onboard more individuals into the ReFi ecosystem, guiding them towards regenerative agricultural practices.

Objective for Funding: Our primary goal is to conduct onboarding activities to increase awareness about the ReFi movement and the importance of transitioning to regenerative agriculture and livestock practices. By raising awareness of such projects and technologies, we believe they will align seamlessly with Guadalajara's trend of new technology-based ventures, gradually leading to a surge in ReFi companies in the region with a global footprint.

Aim: Our primary objective is to harness the power of open-source data generation, making it accessible to academia, government, and the private sector. This data-centric approach aims to expedite access to mechanisms such as carbon credits, biodiversity credits, and circular credits. These mechanisms, vital for the regeneration movement, heavily rely on data accessibility for verification. By democratizing access to this data, we aspire to foster a collaborative environment where various sectors can work in tandem to address Guadalajara's challenges, emphasizing regenerative agriculture and livestock practices.

Budget: We intend to raise 28,200 USD, which will be strategically allocated to achieve the following ambitious outcomes:

Soil Sampling for Project Baseline: 7,000 USD
This will fund comprehensive soil sampling across key agricultural areas in Guadalajara, establishing a baseline for future regenerative efforts and monitoring.

Knowledge-Sharing Workshop on Carbon Sequestration: 4,500 USD

A workshop aimed at sharing knowledge between communities about innovative methods to accelerate carbon sequestration. This will also cover ways to reduce costs on sampling for monitoring and verification using advanced technologies like Neural Networks and Satellite data.

Replicable Model Presentation Workshop: 4,500 USD
This workshop will focus on presenting a replicable model for regenerative agriculture and livestock practices. It will serve as a blueprint for producers and stakeholders interested in transitioning to regenerative practices.

Investment Fund for Local Producers: 10,000 USD
A dedicated fund to support agave, nopal, berries, and livestock producers. This fund will facilitate their transition to regenerative practices by providing them with tools, resources, and knowledge. It will act as a catalyst, ensuring that local producers have the necessary support to adopt and benefit from regenerative practices.

Operational and Miscellaneous Costs: 2,200 USD
These funds will be reserved for any unforeseen expenses, ensuring the smooth execution of all planned activities.

City Overview: Guadalajara, the capital of Jalisco, is a unique blend of tradition and innovation. Historically rooted in agriculture and livestock, it has evolved into a tech hub, making it a nexus of technology and agriculture.
Sustainability Movements in Guadalajara:
SEMADET: A testament to Jalisco's commitment to environmental sustainability, driving sustainable initiatives and policies.

State Program for Climate Change Action: A comprehensive program addressing climate change, emphasizing vulnerability assessments, forest management, and adaptation strategies.

OPD Bosque La Primavera: Dedicated to conserving the La Primavera Flora and Fauna Protection Area, ensuring the preservation of natural resources.
Entrepreneurial and Investment Activity: Guadalajara is positioning itself as a digital and tech hub, with initiatives like Ciudad Creativa Digital and the Innovation Ministry & Startup Landing Pad.
Agricultural and Tech Significance: Jalisco's agricultural prominence, especially in tequila production, combined with its tech expertise, offers a holistic approach to sustainable development.
Conservation and Restoration Potential: The Santiago River Basin, despite challenges from pollution and agricultural runoff, presents a unique opportunity for regeneration due to its ecological significance and conservation efforts.

City’s Needs and Tangible Impact Strategies:
Environmental Awareness and Defense: Strengthening social awareness for environmental assets through community-driven campaigns and technology.

Waste and Water Management: Addressing waste and water challenges through blockchain and industry collaboration.
Mobility and Traffic Management: Improving mobility using data analytics and promoting alternative transportation.

Regenerative Agricultural and Livestock Practices: Transitioning to regenerative practices with financing mechanisms and corporate engagement.
Decentralized Environmental Data: Creating a decentralized platform for data access using blockchain.

Value Consensus through Technology: Establishing value consensus through blockchain platforms.
Metrics for Success: Metrics include increased community participation, waste reduction, traffic flow improvement, adoption of regenerative practices, and data decentralization.

Tech/Startup Sector in Guadalajara: Guadalajara has become a major tech hub in Latin America, with a thriving ecosystem supported by local talent, educational institutions, and government.

Project Overview: The Rancho El Mexicano (REM) initiative in Ixtlahuacán del Río focuses on nature conservation through sustainable and regenerative methodologies. The project aims to rejuvenate the local ecosystem, emphasizing soil health, carbon sequestration, and wildlife augmentation. It seeks to promote regenerative food production and stimulate economic growth by integrating ecosystem regeneration into a productive value chain.

Geographic Focus: The project is located near the Santiago River and the Achichilco Stream, areas of significant ecological importance. The region faces pressures from agriculture, livestock farming, and agave production.

Project Scalability and Replication: REM serves as a practical demonstration of sustainable land use, providing a replicable model for others. The project's scalability is enhanced by the establishment of a natural park, water harvesting initiatives, and the Santiago River initiative.

Benefits of the Project:
Social: Inclusive education and training programs, community empowerment, and behavioral-centered design.

Economic: Augmenting resources for proficient management and promoting sustainable business practices.

Environmental: Fostering ecosystem regeneration and continuous provision of ecosystem services.
Nature Credit Finance: The project seeks nature credit finance to support its conservation initiatives, addressing the degradation of the Santiago and Verde River Ravines. Nature credit finance represents an investment in the project and a sustainable future for the region.

Link to Demand Motivation: The project addresses immediate threats to the region's land and broader systemic issues of climate change and biodiversity loss. It aims to transition the existing supply chain towards regenerative agriculture, offering solutions for climate change adaptation and combating land degradation. The project also emphasizes biodiversity monitoring and data generation, underscoring the systemic relationship between biodiversity and human life.

project.title: ReFi Amsterdam
project.description:
#  Refi Amsterdam 
##  Why Amsterdam needs a Refi node. 
Amsterdam has a rich history of financial innovation. The world’s first central bank and stock exchange were established here. The city has a forward-looking finance sector which is renowned for its commitment to sustainability. Amsterdam is the first in the world to adopt the doughnut economic model, it ranked second on the Global Green Finance Index and it topped the Schroders’ European Sustainable Cities Index in 2021, which found Amsterdam’s environmental policies the best in Europe. The scene is grounded in a vibrant tech and startup ecosystem and sustainability runs through all sectors, from finance to fashion and farming. 
Nevertheless, the climate finance movement is lagging. We don't have as many climate finance startups as a London or Berlin has. Even though the web3 community is thriving and there is a huge legacy of the hippie movement since the 60’s, there is still a strong tendency towards profit over impact.  The role that blockchain can play in our path towards a regenerative society remains underexplored and untold. We believe there is a bridge to build between web3, sustainability and fintech, and therefore we’re raising funds to start a local node. 

##  How we’ll realize our vision
-  **Community building and engagement.** Inspire, educate & spark meaningful conversations and increase awareness around Refi ‘gedachtegoed’. Organize gatherings for like minded people to enhance a sense of belonging and purpose and set up events in collaboration with other stakeholders in the ecosystem (such as universities, municipalities and local web3 communities such as, Copernicus and W3bLab amsterdam). 

-  **Empowering local startups and founders.** amplifying Refi startups based in NL  /projects (Kumo / Landlife / carbify / senken / carbon equity / Coorest / collectivo). 
-  **Facilitate collaboration** and build some cool shit during our monthly coworking sessions. 


##  What is needed to make this happen
We aim to raise a sum of 6k to kick-off a Refi node in Amsterdam in the upcoming 5 months .
- 1x pm coworking  @Collectivo office for 8-10 people. 4x €500 = €2000
- 1x Refi event @Beurs van Berlage. Theme carbon markets or Ubi €1500. 
- 1x Refi Salon icw Project Copernicus €500
- Comms & project management: €2000

##  The driving force behind ReFi Amsterdam:
-  Cynthia de Wolf: Digital marketing consultant who loves to help accelerate startups. Active in web3 since 2017. Core contributor at brightunion.io. Passionate about building communities. Tech enthusiast, tree hugger. loves to dance. 

-  Luuk Weber: Long-term Regen and founder of Kolektivo Labs. Experience running community events in Amsterdam with Blockchain Talks all the way back in 2018.

##  Conclusion 
Refi Amsterdam's goal of establishing a local node to connect web3, sustainability, and fintech aligns well with Amsterdam's history and values. By fostering community engagement, supporting local startups, and facilitating collaboration, Refi Amsterdam aims to contribute to the growth of climate finance initiatives in the city. The grant will enable the establishment of the Refi node and the realization of the initiative's vision.

project.title: ReFi Cohort Node Rio de Janeiro
project.description:
Why Rio?

First of all, Brazil hosts the majority of the Amazon Rainforest, which plays a critical role in global carbon sequestration and biodiversity, is a global leader in renewable energy production, with about 83% of its electricity coming from renewable sources, and is a signatory to the Paris Agreement, committing to reducing its greenhouse gas emissions and taking steps to mitigate climate change.

Rio de Janeiro is known for its lush green spaces, including Tijuca National Park, the largest urban forest in the world, and other protected areas; Provide statistics on the growth of green building certifications (such as LEED) in Rio, demonstrating the city's commitment to sustainable urban development; Rio is also a hub for cultural and artistic expression related to sustainability and environmental awareness; 

What the Node would do?

Connecting Visionaries with Capital:

Rio is a city with a rich history of innovation and sustainability efforts. However, many visionary entrepreneurs and projects often struggle to access the financial resources needed to scale their impact.
The node can act as a nexus, connecting these visionaries with impact investors, venture capitalists, and other sources of funding that share a commitment to sustainability.

Facilitating Impact Investment:

Financial returns are aligned with positive social and environmental outcomes, having the node as a facilitator of impact investment deals, making it easier for investors to identify and support projects that contribute to both financial growth and sustainable development.

Building a Network of Support:

Ccreate a collaborative ecosystem within Rio de Janeiro, bringing together entrepreneurs, investors, policymakers, and community leaders.
This network will provide not only financial support but also mentorship, expertise, and guidance to help sustainable initiatives succeed.

Engaging Local Government and Institutions:

The Node will collaborate with local government bodies, universities, and research institutions to create an ecosystem that attracts investors and bolsters sustainable projects, working in tandem with existing initiatives and amplify their impact.

Including! Social Impact.

Rio has so much of the potential and people to be benefited with the power of the Blockchain technology. But they need to be educated and have access. The Node will have a social aspect on finantial empowerment, specially for those living in the favelas, and on the margin of society. To growth as a community we must growth together. As powerful as a  new technology can be, if it benefits only part of the society, we will never trully develop.

Rio is a city with a rich history of innovation and sustainability efforts. However, many visionary entrepreneurs and projects often struggle to access the financial resources needed to scale their impact.
The node can act as a nexus, connecting these visionaries with impact investors, venture capitalists, and other sources of funding that share a commitment to sustainability.

Facilitating Impact Investment:

Financial returns are aligned with positive social and environmental outcomes, having the node as a facilitator of impact investment deals, making it easier for investors to identify and support projects that contribute to both financial growth and sustainable development.

Building a Network of Support:

Ccreate a collaborative ecosystem within Rio de Janeiro, bringing together entrepreneurs, investors, policymakers, and community leaders.
This network will provide not only financial support but also mentorship, expertise, and guidance to help sustainable initiatives succeed.

Engaging Local Government and Institutions:

The Node will collaborate with local government bodies, universities, and research institutions to create an ecosystem that attracts investors and bolsters sustainable projects, working in tandem with existing initiatives and amplify their impact.

Including! Social Impact.

Rio has so much of the potential and people to be benefited with the power of the Blockchain technology. But they need to be educated and have access. The Node will have a social aspect on finantial empowerment, specially for those living in the favelas, and on the margin of society. To growth as a community we must growth together. As powerful as a  new technology can be, if it benefits only part of the society, we will never trully develop.

project.title: Dynamic Optimization Algorithm for Self-regulating Tokenomics
project.description:
Most tokenomics policies today (e.g. inflation rate, burning rate) are either coded statically or rely on DAO governance for adjustments. This approach ensures decentralization, but the lack of real-time response mechanisms also make the tokenomics vulnerable to the impact of external shocks, such as a large price movements and hacks.

How do we design tokenomics that is robust against these shocks, while preserving decentralization? The bold yet rational answer is: let a bot run the economy.

In this research project, my aim is to build an autonomous algorithm that regulates a blockchain economy with two key parameters: staking rate and burning rate. In particular, I apply a modeling tool from modern macroeconomic theory called DSGE, which is the gold standard used by central banks worldwide to determine key economic parameters like interest rates. Cutting-edge data science tools such as machine learning and causal inference models will be applied in the calibration process. This research will provide guidance for the new generation of protocol tokenomics.

**About the researcher**

My name is Ming and I am a graduate student and researcher at UChicago studying computational economics. I've worked as a research fellow at Nethermind and DeFi research analyst at Polygon. You can learn more about me and my previous work at https://sites.google.com/view/mingxuanhe

**Improvements on existing approaches**

The idea of optimizing burning and staking using dynamic modeling tools has seen growing exploration recently (e.g. @urosnoetic's post about BME in the previous round of TE grants, and multiple papers from the economics/finance literature in 2022/2023). My novelty is to develop a fully testable, calibratable model that also addresses uncertainty and lack of information. I also address key concerns such as algorithmic bias and systemic economic inequalities.

**Current state**

I have formalize the baseline model (Biais et al, 2020) in the context of tokenomics, and I'm currently in the phase of building the full model. [Presentation slides](https://github.com/mingxuan-he/dp-tokenomics/blob/master/Presentations/pitch_slides.pdf) can be found under the project github repo. The slides summarizes the current state of the research project, include a detailed introduction for the project, literature review, some technical components, and next steps.

**Expected outcome**

The expected result is a complete MA thesis paper (15-30 pages) which will go under the review of a graduate research committee at University of Chicago Kenneth C. Griffin Department of Economics. 
The end goal is to publish the paper in a peer-reviewed journal or conference. Before publication, I will open source the working paper and any relevant code on Github. The project is expected to take 4-5 months, with an upper limit of 8 months.

**Funding Usage**

As an international student in the US, it is extremely difficult to receive academic scholarships and research funding because of my foreign status. That's why I turned to this community of fellow builders for help. Funding from this grant would help me cover part of my advanced studies in computational economics as well as some paid research tools. Here's a plan on how the funding will be used on this project:
- Data: will try to use public data for initial stages, but later stages likely requires subscription-based APIs or databases (~$50/month * 5 months)
- Computational resources: I will need to use credit-based computing services such as AWS or the Midway Cluster for running large-scale computation and machine learning models. An example can be found at https://github.com/mingxuan-he/eth-fee-time-series (~$80/month * 5 months)
- Journal/conference submission & traveling expenses (~$1000)
- Total: ~$1650
Any additional funding will be directed towards creating more accessible community content such as explainers, blog posts, and open-source widgets.

project.title: $Earth - Solarpunk Dao
project.description:
Hey **Solarpunk**, stoked to have you here 🌞

Our mission - **Put Eco in Economy**

Our Vision - **Seed the Solarpunk paradigm**

To make this happen we are building **$Earth** - A digital currency thats backed by real world climate assets, ecosystem services provided by those assets and solarpunk values.

[![c4be5546-9432-47eb-9701-539a9463e73d-logo-1.png](https://i.postimg.cc/wj5qjVNW/c4be5546-9432-47eb-9701-539a9463e73d-logo-1.png)](https://postimg.cc/gxJFM3NR)


# $Earth leverages crypto-economics and blockchain to -

1. Mobilize and incentivize primary finance for projects in the following sectors that are building infrastructure for an absolute zero emission future and address the massive climate finance gap of over $4-5 Trillion/yr needed to do so :

- **Clean Energy**☀️
- **Regenerative Agriculture**🌱
- **Clean Transport**⚡
- **Ecosystem Conservation**🐆
- **Solarpunk Spaces**🌇


2. Create pricing mechanisms to **value natural ecosystems and their services** while creating a monetary system that is backed by assets catering to our core needs

3. Program **solarpunk values** into a currency


[![0-1-3.png](https://i.postimg.cc/8cGrXbqx/0-1-3.png)](https://postimg.cc/sQnXv5fJ)


# To make this happen, $Earth has been designed to -

1. Incentivize degens, regens, treegens and solarpunks to **purge their petro $$$ for $Earth** which has a floating, range bound currency design. $Earth holders then use Quadratic Voting to determine which verified projects get funded via the treasury.

2. Inherently ascribing value to ecosystem services created by the projects we fund, by selling $Earth at a premium to the $ value of projects in the neoliberal world.

$Earth acts as a **new unit of value** for the $ value of the projects in our treasury + potential yields these projects will generate + the positive externalities created by these projects ( healthy soil, carbon sequestration, clean air, biodiversity etc) + solarpunk values it manifests

3. Generating utility for $Earth by creating a **network of regenerative/solarpunk merchants** who are willing to provide their goods and services in exchange of $Earth.

# Due to your incredible support in the Beta round where we managed to come 4th from 102 participants we were able to -

1. Finally register our entity from which we can officially issue $Earth.
2. Pay for our legal tool kit which contains important documents such as Terms of Service, Privacy policy, KYC/AML policy to offer $Earth.
3. Pay our devs
4. Hire an intern to help us with community building and operations
5. Keep aside a smol budget for marketing and promoting $Earth once we launch ( hopefully done by the time you are reading this)
6. Launch our #SolarpunkUniverse NFT collection where we are creating bespoke Solarpunk characters, a truly one of its kind NFT collection
7. Continue survivng the bear and working full time on this project
8. Initiate payment for KYC services and pay for AI tools like Midjourney, Kaiber

# Solarpunk #16,17 and 19 from our #SolarpunkUniverseNFT collection

[![Screenshot-2023-08-04-192309.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/c1THNZYv/Screenshot-2023-08-04-192309.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/QV9sp2fD)

# With the funds expected from this round we will be working on -

1. Creating a smart contract that serves as an aqueduct for $Earth, where lending/borrowing platform and Dexes will be able to let their users redirect yields earned from there towards minting/staking $Earth
2. Hire solarpunks to help us with content creation, community management and provide us with Credit Risk recommendations on the projects that $Earth treasury intends to fund
3. Launch 2 more NFT collections that will also serve as aqueducts for $Earth and assist in community building.
4. Create a subsidiary entity that interacts with real world entities and holds our investment deeds
5. Pay a designer to create a new version of the website+dapp
6. Initiate dialouge with aligned partners whose projects we seek to fund and have them serve as collateral for $Earth.
7. Keep a budget to market and promote $Earth
8. Hopefully to be able to conduct an IRL event to shill $Earth


Would be important to mention here that we are on the verge of launching $Earth on mainnet and this has been made possible only because of all the love from our contributors and incredible support from Gitcoin. 

We are extremely grateful for this  and are working tirelessly to deliver the solarpunk future 🙏

project.title: ChainPray
project.description:
## Introduction
When you step into ChainPray, this unique blockchain prayer platform, you will discover **a world full of warmth and care**. Unlike those projects solely focused on wealth and profits, ChainPray chooses to turn its attention to ordinary users in the cryptocurrency community who have been affected by hackers, bad actors, and liquidations, providing them with heartfelt spiritual support to make them feel truly cared for and supported.

ChainPray ingeniously blends traditional prayers with advanced blockchain technology. On this magical platform, every user has the right to **claim one "PrayLuck" (PrayLuck Coin) for free every day**. By activating the daily prayer feature, users receive blessings from the blockchain, starting their day with positivity and goodness. This precious gift allows you to feel the platform's thoughtfulness and care.

In addition, ChainPray offers many exciting and meaningful additional features, such as "**Destiny Pray**", "**GoodMan Contributions**", "**God Competitions**", and "**Sunny Award**". These features not only add fun but also make you experience the colorful and wonderful aspects of life.

## Token Pass System
ChainPray's token economy consists of two tokens, **PrayLuck** and **PrayLuckStar**, along with the issuance of **NFTs** with different attributes. PrayLuckStar is obtained by users through the probability of "Destiny Pray", and the more times users pray, the more accumulated luck they have, making it easier to obtain PrayLuckStar. ChainPray also releases NFTs with various attributes to help users acquire PrayLuckStar more easily. For detailed information, please refer to the TokenPlan section on the [ChainPray official website](https://chainpray.com).

## Profit and Rewards
ChainPray's mission is not limited to providing spiritual support to cryptocurrency users. During the project's operation, **DAO will regularly distribute the "Sunny Award" of PrayLuck to random ChainPray users**. This portion of PrayLuck comes entirely from users' prayer consumption, reflecting a concept of "**taking from the people, giving back to the people.**" In the later stages of the ChainPray project, PrayLuckStar obtained through Destiny Prayers will have various consumer use cases, such as purchasing advertising space on ChainPray, issuing chain-wide announcements, buying unique NFTs, and more. Therefore, ChainPray will generate profits, and **the DAO will continue to use a significant portion of the profits to carry out "Sunny Award" for random ChainPray users**.

## Team
ChainPray's backend team boasts 5 years of experience in the internet industry and **5 years of experience in blockchain development**. Additionally, the smart contract development team has **4 years of experience specifically in Ethereum smart contracts**. The smart contracts used by ChainPray are developed using **Solidity**, ensuring simplicity and have undergone a thorough audit by multiple seasoned smart contract developers with years of experience in the cryptocurrency community. This ensures that **there are no contract security issues present**.

## Invitation card
We sincerely invite you to personally experience the unique charm of ChainPray and let your soul be nurtured and enlightened. ChainPray looks forward to sharing unforgettable moments with you, creating beautiful and heartwarming memories together. On this platform filled with blessings and care, let us embark on an unforgettable journey together.

project.title: 0x Salon
project.description:
**Fau0x Salon Governance RPG Card Deck**

We at the 0x Salon have developed a non-Web3-specific card game (Fau0x Salon, 2021) which serves as a discursive tool for participants to role-play post-disciplinary conversations from a variety of perspectives. The card deck "pops-up" salon-style events (intimate and diverse peer-group discussions) with some facilitation, allowing participants to role-play through problems, topics, and governance tensions from the perspectives of fictional character archetypes rather than themselves. We have been invited to present the Fau0x Salon project in an exhibition in Switzerland in November. The 2021 version of the card deck is here: https://www.are.na/0x-salon/wip-salon-deck-v2

We would like to prepare a Web3-specific version of this card deck, and seek contributions to help us with R&D, design, playtest, and production costs. Our goal is to complete a new version of the deck, do a series of playtests and workshops at Web3 events, make many hard copies available, and open-source the deck so that anyone can print their own copy and play.

In a way, we are developing a "Web3 governance therapy tool" ﻿🚀﻿. One problem we are trying to solve is around the 'eternal September' problem of welcoming new people into the Web3 ecosystem with nuanced and unbiased information. There's also a related challenge, in the 'governance' of the human organisations that necessarily form around decentralised protocols, such as foundations, startups, benefactors, investors, as well as developers, miners / validators / service providers, users, …. Due to the complex balance of stakeholder incentives in Ethereum and other Web3 networks, individual stakeholders may not be incentive-aligned, which can lead to “off-chain tensions” or even adversarial behaviour that is detrimental to the protocol.

Due to these somewhat split loyalties, and the distributed nature of many Web3 project teams, time spent together IRL (where communication is most effective) is scarce. Having a “governance RPG” as a tool for teams to role-play through scenarios would enable team members to work through points of tension, without bringing their own personal characters or desiderata into the equation.  

**About the 0x Salon**
0x Salon is a collective endeavour which critically interrogates digital culture — primarily that of the blockchain community — through discourse events and residencies, producing scholarly and creative interventions in the process. 

Since 2020, we have been hosting salons ⁠— intimate post-disciplinary discussions ⁠— on a range of conversation topics. We are conducting an ongoing, non-profit experiment in knowledge sharing and collective cultural production. 

Stewarded by 0x Salon team members, our community researches topics, organises events, and produces lore, critical theory, poetry, philosophy, games, theatre, and visual art. Our website principally functions as a transmedia archival space, chronicling discussions within the 0x Salon and the resulting activities.

///

Wassim Z. Alsindi PhDWassim is the founder and creative director of the 0x Salon, which conducts experiments in post-disciplinary collective knowledge practices. A veteran of the timechain, Wassim specialises in conceptual design and philosophy of peer-to-peer systems, on which he writes, speaks, teaches, and consults. He has an editorial column at the MIT Computational Law Report, and he co-founded MIT’s Cryptoeconomic Systems journal and conference series. Wassim has curated arts festivals, led a sculptural engineering laboratory and published experimental music, satirical theatre, poetry, and speculative scripture. Wassim holds a Ph.D. in ultrafast supramolecular photophysics from the University of Nottingham.
